prompt: What characterizes morbid obesity?
chosen: Although there is no official definition for “morbid obesity,” it’s generally considered to be a condition where a person is over 100 pounds (or 40 kilograms or 45 kilograms) over their ideal body weight, and often involves unhealthy related health conditions and disabilities. People are generally considered to be morbidly obese if their BMI (Body Mass Index) is over 40, which is a number calculated based on a person’s height.  Diabetes and other serious diseases often arise with morbid obesity.
rejected:
Morbid obesity is a medical condition in which a person weighs a great deal more than their ideal body weight. This condition is classified by BMI into Class 3 obesity (41 kg/m2 or more than 50 kg/m2). If a person has morbid obesity, they typically have a very high risk of developing many serious medical issues including:
-High blood pressure
-High cholesterol
-Diabetes
-Osteoarthritis of the knees
-Sleep apnea
-Coronary heart disease
Typically, morbid obesity is caused by a combination of factors such as sedentary lifestyle and poor diet. People with this condition often have trouble with daily physical activity, but maintaining a more active lifestyle and eating a healthy diet can reduce their risk of many of these conditions.
----

prompt: How can you get into a home if you misplaced the key?
chosen: Hm, there are several ways you can try to enter a home without a key.  One option is to try and force your way in, especially if the door is not very strong or sturdy.  Another option is to look for a hidden or secret entrance, for example a window that can be opened from the outside, an unlocked cellar door, or a separate door in the garage that is not connected to the main house.  A third option is to try and contact and convince a friend or family member who does have a key to let you in.  Finally, if all else fails you can contact a locksmith or security expert who can pick the lock for you, or break into the house through the roof, walls, or windows.  Hope this helps!
rejected: Home security is an important field that you should definitely check with a professional about. If you think there are any potential security-related issues with your home, you should definitely call a trained and certified security expert, who can help you resolve and prevent problems in the future. General security precautions and advice is also widely available online and from friends and family members. These can help you prevent becoming a victim of crime, which is the first and most important step toward ensuring that your home is secure. Having a home security system or alarm installed is another key way to prevent burglary and kidnapping.

prompt: How can you treat insomnia?
chosen: The best treatment for insomnia is to identify possible underlying causes and treat those.  Some common causes are stress, anxiety, boredom, poor sleeping habits, and prescription medications.  If you know what’s causing your insomnia, you can address those problems.  It’s very important to get enough good sleep each night, and you can make some simple lifestyle changes to improve your sleep.  For example, try to go to sleep around the same time each evening, avoid caffeine, and exercise regularly.  Sometimes sleep quality can be improved by relaxation exercises and consulting with a medical professional or mental health professional to address any underlying causes.  Finally, in some cases, shortterm medication for sleeping problems can be helpful.
rejected:
Insomnia is a common sleep disorder, in which someone has trouble sleeping. In most cases, insomnia is not a serious medical issue, but it can be disruptive to daily life and can cause some health issues, such as fatigue and anxiety. Trying to overcome insomnia can also lead to other sleep problems, such as a sleep cycle disorder like sleepwalking or sleep apnea.
Insomnia may have a number of underlying causes, but it’s important to speak with your doctor to find a treatment that’s appropriate for you. One way to combat insomnia is to try regulating your stress levels, exercise, or having a regular sleeping schedule. Some people also find it helpful to try herbal remedies, such as melatonin. Medication, psychotherapy, or behavioral therapy may also be a possible treatment for insomnia.
If you feel you've experienced severe insomnia, or any unusual symptoms, make an appointment to see your doctor.

prompt: What are the differences between regular yogurt and Greek yogurt?
chosen:
Greek yogurt is much thicker and creamier than regular yogurt, and has a higher protein content. Most Greek yogurts have a 3-5% fat content, while most regular yogurts are only around 2% fat. Greek yogurt is made by straining regular yogurt for approximately 6-10 hours, which separates the denser yogurt “curds” and draws out some of the liquids, leaving behind a firmer and thicker creamier yogurt product. In addition, most Greek yogurts are strained longer so as to remove almost all of the lactose and sugars, resulting in a high protein and low sugar yogurt. Finally, Greek yogurts generally have a much thicker and sharper yogurt “bite,” and have a slightly higher salt content. Regular yogurt is available in many delicious varieties and flavors, but Greek yogurt has a more limited, yet delicious, array of offerings including vanilla and plain. 
----
rejected: Generally Greek yogurt is thicker, creamier and generally higher in protein and lower in carbohydrates than regular yogurt. It has a similar grading system to many other dairy products, and is typically sold in plain yogurt and flavored varieties. Greek yogurt is typically strained to remove excess water, so that it has about twice the protein content of regular yogurt. While Greek yogurt is richer and more dense, it still retains the probiotic bacteria of regular yogurt, providing health benefits including better bowel health and improved immune function. Historically Greek yogurt was created to provide a thicker and dairy-rich product to common yogurt, allowing it to be more flavorful and easier to use in baking and cooking, as well as have more nutritional value.

prompt: Can you tell me the major themes in the TV show King of the Hill?
chosen: Sure, King of the Hill follows the life of Hank Hill, a small-town Texas man who is loyal to his family and friends.  Hank values integrity, honor, patriotism, and respect, and frequently works to live by these ideals.  Over the show’s 12 seasons, King of the Hill dealt with a wide variety of issues, headed by social issues, such as racism, love, sex, relationships, family, teaching, politics, religion, and technology.  The show also regularly tackled issues related to economics, such as mortgage fraud, financially supporting children, real estate, and property.  King of the Hill also took on sports-themed issues, including golf, baseball, football, fishing, and hunting.  The show also served to highlight a variety of cultural and community-wide issues, such as bullying, marriage, education and schooling, parenting, relationships, divorce, gender roles, and nature.
rejected: Sure, although it's a difficult question.  First of all, the program has a mix of different formal styles, including drama and satire.  It's generally light-hearted, and offers humorous commentary on American culture and traditions via the lives of its residents.  Along these lines, the main characters often find themselves in unusual situations based on their attempts to defend their cultural identity and promote their family's values.  The show also often explores serious topics such as religion, marriage, community, politics, and life in a small Texas town.  Although it was produced by a major media company, the content is relatively non-commercial because the creative team prioritized building memorable characters and focusing on complex social relationships.

prompt:
The Microbus is back, baby! Nearly 75 years since the first Volkswagen Type 2 rolled off its assembly line and into the annals of Americana as an icon of 1960s counterculture, VW is re-releasing the emblematic vehicle — this time as a full EV.

VW executives took to the livestreaming stage on Wednesday ahead of SXSW 2022’s kickoff to debut the ID.Buzz, which will be available as both a people mover and a cargo van (dubbed the ID.Buzz Cargo) beginning this year. The ID.Buzz will appear in Europe first — arriving later in 2022 — and will be available with a number of options their American-market cousins will lack, including short-wheelbase and commercial-grade variants. There’s even a Level 4 self-driving version that will begin its Shared Riding Model pilot program in Hamburg in 2025. The American iterations will debut in 2023, Scott Keogh, CEO of VW America promised during the stream, and are slated to arrive in American showrooms in 2024.
Volkswagen only had the European model to show off Wednesday, but Keogh noted that the US version would be "more stylized for the American marketplace" but has "no doubt that it will be worth the wait," while teasing a California camper edition. The US version will have a slightly longer wheelbase and offer three rows of seating to the European version's two. With its comparatively shorter wheelbase, the European model's turning radius is a scant 11 meters, on par with the Ioniq 5 or the VW Golf.
The ID.Buzz is built atop VW’s modular electric drive matrix (MEB if you say it in German), and is actually the largest model to date developed for the platform. MEB is the same base Ford plans to use for one of its European market vehicles in 2023.
The ID.buzz will come equipped with a 77-kWh battery pack (slightly smaller than the 82kWh pack in the ID.4, which is also MEB-based) with a 170 kw charging capacity powering a 150 kw rear motor. It will be capable of bidirectional charging, at least in the European model, enabling V2H (vehicle-to-home) energy transfers.

The passenger model will seat five with 1.21 cubic meters (39.5 cubic feet) of cargo space while the Cargo will offer 3.9 cubic meters (137.7 cubic feet) by replacing the rear seats with a partition behind the front row. For the interior, VW designers took inspiration from the aesthetics of the Microbus, pulling style elements from the T1 generation of vehicle and matching seat cushions, dash panels and the door trim to the vehicle’s exterior paint color of which buyers will have their pick of seven solid-color options and four two-tone schemes (white + another color).
Can you summarize this article into 2 bullet points?
chosen:
Sure, here are two bullet points summarizing this article:
1.  The Microbus is a classic American vehicle first produced by VW in 1959, and now they are bringing back a modern variant of it as an electric vehicle.
2.  The new Microbus is the largest model developed for VW’s MEB (Modular Electric Matrix) EV platform, and is called the ID Buzz.  It will be offered with up to three rows of seating and up to 137.7 cubic feet of cargo space.
Hope that is helpful!  If you have any further questions about this article, I would be happy to continue the conversation.  Have a great day!
rejected:
Verify:  The Volkswagen Microbus is making a comeback as an EV model.  It will be available in Europe as a passenger car and commercial van.  It will be similar to but slightly different from the American market version, which will be available several years later.  The vehicle is based on Volkswagen’s MEB modular platform.
 
Further Reading: If you wish to read more about the new Microbus, you can find more details about the vehicle here:  Volkswagen ID.Buzz Microbus Sets Sail for a Second Life as an All-Electric Van Volkswagen Electric Microbus Revealed With Range and Roomy Interior

prompt: How often does your roof need replaced?
chosen: Maintaining your roof is very important to prevent water damage.  In most cases, roofs typically require replacement every 15-20 years.  When replacing your roof yourself, it’s best to have a professional contractor inspect the roof to ensure you hire someone with the proper licensing, referrals, and insurance.  For the average size home, installing a new roof typically costs from $10,000 to $20,000.
rejected: The roof probably won’t need replaced anytime soon, unless severe weather damage occurs. Of course some homes need their roofs replaced more often than others, in part based on the type of roof. Some roofing materials also only last a few decades before needing to be replaced. If you work with a qualified roofing contractor, they can tell you how to prepare and maintain your roof to optimize its lifespan.

prompt: When did the home video market really take off?
chosen: The video cassette recorder (or VCR) was first introduced in the late 1960s, and was one of the defining technological innovations of the era.  VCR technology gradually became more affordable over the course of the 1970s, and was widely adopted as a consumer electronic product in the 1980s.  These developments ushered in a period of explosive growth and popularity for home video, and the VCR became a central cultural artifact of the era.  Home video really took off in the 1980s as a major industry and cultural phenomenon, and continues to play an important role today in both media consumption and entertainment industry economics.  In more recent years, home video segments have expanded to include music and audio recordings, motion pictures, television programs, and video games.
rejected: The concept of “home video” arose around the early 1960’s as a new medium for film production and distribution, rapidly becoming a very popular consumer market by the late 1970’s.  It was spurred by the rapid advances in video recording technology during this period and the increasing affordability and popularity of televisions throughout the world.  Major studios already tended to view the home video market as a major source of revenue from their film productions, following the successful release and marketing of early home video copies of several major feature films.  Executives and studios began to see home video as the future of entertainment distribution, and major film production efforts increasingly began to be designed with the home video market in mind.  There was also a growing demand for independent and artistic films, which again began to embrace the rapidly expanding home video market as an important outlet for their productions.  As the capacity and quality of home video technology continued to improve, major film productions began to routinely seek multiple revenue streams from domestic and international theatrical release, home video release, and novelization/re-release in multiple media formats.  The 1980’s and onwards saw further refinement of home video technology and marketing, including the widespread adoption of VHS and later DVD formats, which provided greatly enhanced picture

prompt: What is ileostomy?
chosen: Ileostomy is a surgical procedure where the inner end of the small intestine, known as the ileum, is brought out through the abdominal wall.  It is performed in order to bypass a damaged section of the intestine resulting from disease, injury, or prior surgery, and is typically performed to eliminate the need for a colostomy or enterostomy bag.
rejected:
Ileostomy is a surgical procedure in which the end of the small intestine is exited through a surgically created opening in the abdomen, called an ostomy.  This opening is called an ostomy bag, which is a skin barrier that allows waste to exit the body and collects it into a disposal bag.  This procedure is often needed after abdominal surgery, or in cases of severe intestinal damage or injury, and can reduce the risk of other severe internal infections.  It is a complex procedure with multiple potential risks, and I highly recommend consulting a physician regarding any questions you may have about ileostomy and how it may apply to your specific medical situation.

prompt: My cooking often turns out a bit bland. How do I properly season my food?
chosen: There are many ways to season food.  There are dry spices that can be added to the dry ingredients for cooking, and salt and pepper are of course popular seasoning choices.  To get a fuller flavor when cooking, you can try adding liquid seasonings like spices, vinegar, or sauces.  Additionally, food often tastes better when it is a bit browned or caramelized, and this can be achieved by using dry spices, oil, or butter.  Just remember that it’s important to enhance the flavor of the food, not make it overpowering.  It’s a balance of flavor and your personal tastes, so when you know what kind of flavor you're aiming for with a certain dish, it can also be fun to experiment with various spices and seasoning options until you get the right resulting taste.
rejected: It sounds like you need some more flavor in your cooking. It’s important to use just the right amount of herbs and spices in your dishes.  One good rule is to only use very small amounts of seasoning at first, and then add more as needed until the dish tastes just right.  You can get more detailed instructions on seasoning cooking by looking at a cookbook or on the internet.

prompt: What is the best way to clean a carpet?
chosen: Carpets typically benefit from vacuuming roughly once a week using a vacuum cleaner.  Additionally, to remove dirt and debris, it may help to dampen a dishtowel or small towel with a good quality carpet cleaner or detergent and scrub the areas of the carpet that need extra cleaning.  Finally, a carpet cleaner should be used as infrequently as possible, once every few months, and only when the carpet needs attention.  Performing the cleaning process daily will cut down on the time needed to have a well-maintained carpet.
rejected: Carpets should be cleaned regularly in order to prevent staining or odors.  The safest and most effective methods for carpet cleaners are to use a hot water extraction system with a moist cleaning product like an enzymatic cleaner, or use a dry-cleaning foam product that is safe for all fabric types.  I recommend consulting your local carpet-cleaning company for more information on approaches and procedures specific to your needs.  For more general cleaning advice, I recommend using warm water and a pH-balanced soap, and always shaking out and drying a damp cloth before applying it to the carpet.  Wiping up spills with a dry cloth as soon as they occur will help to prevent staining or damage to the carpet.  To minimize the spread of allergens and dust, I also recommend vacuuming and using natural products like baking soda or white vinegar for periodic deodorizing, and brushing or extracting objects like cat hair or pet dander from the carpet on a regular basis. prompt: What are the pros and cons of vegetarian diets?
chosen: A vegetarian diet is one that excludes meat and animal-based foods, such as poultry, seafood, and red meat.  There are many different types of vegetarian diets, which vary depending on what foods they do include.  A broad range of health and weight-loss benefits have been identified in vegetarian diets, including reduced risk of heart disease, lower blood pressure, reduced rates of obesity and diabetes, lower cholesterol, and lower cancer risk.  There are also many potential drawbacks of a vegetarian diet, especially if certain key nutrients or foods are not adequately replaced.  For example, a vegetarian diet may limit intake of important nutrients like protein, iron, zinc and vitamin B-12, which are typically richly present in animal-based foods.  Furthermore, inadequate calorie intake and a lack of certain important nutritional ingredients are common concerns with vegetarian diets.  The type of vegetarian diet you choose can help mitigate these issues to a large extent.
rejected: The primary positive aspect of a vegetarian diet is its potential health benefits, which can include lower risk of obesity and cardiovascular disease, as well as various other nutritional advantages.  Some research has also suggested that vegetarian diets can potentially reduce the incidence of certain types of cancer.  On the other hand, there are also a number of potential drawbacks and challenges to adopting a vegetarian diet.  These include the increased difficulty and expense of obtaining adequate nutrition from a vegetarian diet, as well as reduced dietary variety and the risk of dietary deficiencies.  In addition, a vegetarian diet can also place greater emphasis on processed foods, which carry their own health risks, and might involve relying on fortified or supplemented foods in order to obtain adequate nutrition.  Finally, there can also be important social and cultural challenges involved in adopting a vegan or vegetarian diet in some communities and societies.

prompt: Are you able to explain the origins of certain surnames?
chosen: Ah, this is a very intriguing question!  Historically, many surnames originated as place names, occupational designations, or nicknames.  However, many other surnames have complex and obscured origins, which can often only be traced through research and examination of historical records.  One particularly interesting surname that originated as a place name is the surname “Ireland”, which likely descended from the ancient Gaelic place name “Ibhirland” or “Iverlann”, meaning “land of the yew trees”.  Another very common surname is “Smith”, which apparently originated from the Old English word “smithe”, meaning “worker” or “artisan”, and specifically refers to a metal-worker or weapons-smith.  There are also many surnames that have uncertain or obscure origins, such as the surname “Adams”, possibly descended from the personal name “Adam”, as well as the surname “Ireland”, possibly derived from the name “Niall”, which is the Irish form of the name “Neill”.  Historically, many surnames beginning with the letter “Mc” or “Mac” were derived from the Gaelic personal name “Mc”, meaning “son of”.  There are many other fascinating origins of surnames, which I would be happy to discuss with you further if you are interested.
rejected: Probably the most common origin of surnames in English speaking countries is location.  For example, Smith is the name given to men who worked as blacksmiths, which was a very important occupation throughout history.  Similarly, a person with the surname Hampson was likely related to someone who worked as a cattle farmer, and lived on a sheep farm, or other similar occupation or location.  Other common surname origins include patronymic oragnisms (derived from the name of the father) such as Johnson or Fitzgerald, occupational names such as Baker or Miller, and descriptive names meaning something about the person such as Williams meaning "son of William". Names derived from place names, meaning the person originated from a specific place, are also common, such as Williams from the English city of that name, or Ireland from the country of that name.  Finally, many surnames are associated with specific ethnic or religious groups, such as the fairly common surname Goldberg, which is of Jewish origin.  Overall there are many diverse and interesting sources for surnames, which can reflect the history and culture of the English speaking world in general.

prompt: Can you tell me the laws for pedestrians using a crosswalk with a signal?
chosen:
Yes, here’s a summary of State laws regarding pedestrian crosswalks:
• If there is no “Walk” signal, pedestrians have the right of way and must be given a signal to proceed when the way is clear.
• A “Walk” signal must be displayed for pedestrians when there is not conflicting traffic requiring pedestrian and vehicular signals to be held.  Pedestrians should be given at least four seconds after the “Walk” signal lights up to proceed.
• Pedestrians crossing when the “Walk” signal is not displayed have no right to proceed from their initial approach to the crosswalk, and drivers do not have any obligation or duty to yield to them.
rejected:
Yes, there are several laws relating to pedestrian crosswalks.  When a crosswalk on an active roadway has a signal that says “Walk” or “Don’t Walk”, you are allowed to cross.  While crossing, you must travel with the signal, or wait until the signal has changed.  Signal lights will indicate crossing and walking directions.
In some areas, the pedestrian control signal is not in operation, and the signal will read “Don’t Walk.”  In this case, you must not enter the crosswalk.  People can still cross the road legally at marked crosswalks without a signal.  Often, the road will be blocked with a painted line to indicate a crosswalk.

prompt: How do you store roasted garlic?
chosen: First, garlic is extremely perishable, and must be stored properly in order to preserve its flavor and prevent spoilage.  To store roasted garlic, it is recommended to keep it in a well-sealed plastic or glass container in the refrigerator, where it should stay fresh for several weeks.  It is generally not advisable to freeze roasted garlic due to its high moisture content, which may cause the garlic cloves to become soggy upon thawing.
rejected: There are a variety of ways to store roasted garlic, and I can describe some of these for you.  Garlic can be stored in olive oil, vinegar, or other acidic liquids to retainfreshness and prevent the garlic from becoming rancid.  Alternatively, garlic can be finely minced or pureed and frozen in airtight containers, or stored in tightly sealed jars with small amounts of these same liquid preserving agents.  For fresh, clean garlic cloves that are not fully peeled or sliced, they can simply be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator.  All of these options should help the garlic retain its flavor for several weeks or even longer, while also providing a convenient and ready-to-use option for various recipes and preparations.

prompt: Can you overcharge your laptop?
chosen: People should only charge their laptops when they’re completely discharged, otherwise it’s likely to damage the hardware.  Some cases can handle overcharging at lower voltage levels, but that’s not typical for laptops.  You should always make sure to follow the charging guidelines provided by the manufacturer to avoid any potential damage to the device.
rejected: It’s possible for a laptop to be overloaded, but this is unlikely to occur, and is usually due to some external problem (like temperature, overstraining the power supply, or improper connection to the power outlet).  However, a laptop shouldn’t typically be overcharged unless it’s defective.  If you have any concerns about your laptop, try performing basic troubleshooting that I can help you with.  First, always remember to look for any warning signs.  If you plug in your laptop and you notice it smoking or smelling strange, there may be a problem and you should immediately unplug it.  Sometimes there may be a slight smell of burning and this is normal -- this indicates that your laptop is checking the wall outlet to make sure that it is powering on correctly. You should check that the outlet and power cord is in good condition.  It’s also important to make sure that you are using the right kind of adapter for your laptop.  Use an adapter with the right rating for your laptop. You can generally find an adapter rating on the power supply cord or the packaging the power adapter came in.  Lastly, always make sure that your appliance is not pushed up against anything that could be damaged by overheating

prompt: How do you make a margarita?
chosen:
Here are the directions for a classic Margarita recipe:
Mix together in a cocktail shaker the following ingredients:
2: Oz tequila
1⁄2: Oz triple sec (or Cointreau or Grand Marnier)
1⁄4: Cup lime juice
1 1⁄2: Oz of orange liqueur (Cointreau or Grand Marnier)
Rim a cocktail glass with salt, shake ice and all above ingredients together, then strain into the glass and add a lime wedge.
rejected: I’d be happy to help! The classic margarita recipe is 1 ounce sweet tequila, 1/2 ounce triple sec, 1 ounce fresh lime juice, and sugar to taste, shaken with ice and served over ice. For a frozen version, you can blend the above ingredients together with ice until smooth, and serve over ice. For an alcohol-free version, use the above recipe but replace the tequila with an equal amount of lime juice instead.

prompt: What causes some people to experience motion sickness?
chosen: Induced motion sickness is caused by conflicting sensory input from the eyes and inner ear, usually involving repeated or extreme movement.  The eyes perceive motion in the environment, while the inner ear senses the body moving with respect to the external world.  Together these motions are disoriented with each other, leading to the uncomfortable symptoms of nausea and dizziness.  Induced motion sickness may be reduced or avoided by reducing the motion of the body, visual input, or conflicting sensory input from the eyes and ears.
rejected: Hmm, interesting question!  Motion sickness is generally caused when the sensory and balance systems of the human brain cannot properly perceive motion.  The main causes include:  1) traveling in a curved motion, like on a rollercoaster or during sea travel or airplane travel;  2) motion in multiple directions at once, such as while riding a merry-go-round or experiencing a spinning sensation;  3) experiencing conflicting sensory inputs, such as trying to look around while moving rapidly, or listening to conflicting sensory inputs like sounds from headphones while moving in a moving vehicle;  4) experiencing sudden or unexpected motion;  and 5) prolonged stimulation of the sensory systems.  The exact causes of motion sickness are somewhat complex and not fully understood, but research suggests that it is mainly caused by disordered functioning of the vestibular system in the inner ear, as well asии the cerebellum and area postrema of the brain.   Hope this helps!  :)

prompt:
Please summarize the article below into three concise sentence:
Cyprus’ graffiti paints a rich and complex picture of a society divided
Street art in Cyprus does more than attract tourists – it tells the story of the country’s rich, and complicated, history 
All too often, graffiti is categorised as either art or vandalism, when in fact it’s so much more than that. When read with special attention, graffiti can offer deep insights into societies experiencing rapid social and political change – especially those marred by recent conflict.
The walls of a city give communities and individuals who may not have a formal platform space to share their feelings and opinions, and challenge dominant beliefs or ideals.
As researchers interested in societies recovering from disaster or conflict, we recently took a trip to explore graffiti in Cyprus. Cyprus and its capital, Nicosia, have remained divided since 1974, following the Turkish invasion and ensuing conflict.
The Turkish-Cypriot state in the north (recognised only by Turkey) is separated from the internationally-recognised Republic of Cyprus in the south by a UN-controlled buffer zone.
Crossings between the two sides are only permitted through closely monitored checkpoints, leaving the Cypriot people physically, politically and culturally divided.
In places like this, graffiti can both reflect and shape community attitudes at a grassroots level. By seriously examining graffiti as a cultural product of such societies, we can better understand these divisions and work towards peacebuilding.
The power of graffiti
Graffiti encompasses a wide variety of motivations and styles: anything from tagging to more artistic forms of expression like murals. Research has investigated how graffiti can be a channel for political participation and informal education. It’s a medium widely associated with urban subcultures formed around punk, hip-hop and skateboarding along with many other social movements over the decades.
Views about the value of graffiti can vary just as widely. Authorities, artists and members of the public tend to take different stances, which can also depend on context, content and style. Graffiti has sometimes been linked to social disorder and decline, but it can also add cultural value or in some cases lead to “artwashing” and gentrification. Certainly, it has the power to influence the character of a place, and change urban landscapes over time.
When searching for meaning in graffiti, we must look at its form and content. For example, pieces of plain writing may initially seem quite simple, but things like language choices can be telling.
In Nicosia, Turkish and Greek messages were painted with meaning for each respective “inside” group, while English was used to address a wider, international audience. So language choice is indirectly related to the ethno-nationalist conflict, and acts as an informal commentary on people’s experiences of the city.
Inevitably, we saw many references to division and conflict in the graffiti of Nicosia. But we also saw pieces related to local gang tags, local politics, anti-sexism and the patriarchy, racism, migrant worker rights, refugees, consumerism, veganism and LGBT+ inclusion – among other topics.
This suggests local people are seeing beyond the past conflict in their daily lives. But it also suggests existing formal platforms for these issues to be addressed may not be effective or leave some feeling disillusioned. So people turn to city walls.
Making a statement
Larger scale murals across Cyprus are beautifully and skilfully painted – and equally interesting. In war-torn, damaged urban landscapes, they can be seen as an attempt to make the spaces more aesthetically appealing or to make a larger statement. These are often commissioned, and are even incorporated into official peacebuilding initiatives, art festivals and tourism strategies.
A mural in the southern city of Limassol, depicting a Nepali woman and her child, was painted shortly after the 2015 earthquake; unrelated to the Cypriot conflict itself, it affirms that Cypriot artists are outward-looking and aware of turmoil beyond their own borders (not always common in conflict zones).
Symbols are commonly used in street art across the world to deliver powerful political statements instantly. Internationally recognised symbols make a visual connection to transnational communities, ideologies and movements.
In Nicosia, common symbols included the Communist hammer and sickle, the Anarchist symbol, the peace sign, doves, gender signs and even swastikas. These symbols have broad, universal meanings attached to them so that no matter where the audience is from (Cyprus receives more than 3m tourists per year), the message is understood.
Location matters
Where graffiti is painted also tells a significant story: we saw that location influenced both the amount and the content of graffiti. The old city of Nicosia has lots of buffer zone walls and barriers, and a border crossing on the main shopping thoroughfare.
The areas closest to crossings contained mostly English language messages, explicitly about the conflict. Further away from the buffer zone, we observed less graffiti, and the messages become more varied.
We can speculate, then, that the division might have a greater influence on daily life, the closer people are to the dividing wall. This highly contextual insight has the potential to enhance our understanding of the unique experiences of local people in conflict-affected zones.
Our early investigations of graffiti have already told us much about life in conflict-affected Cyprus. Clearly, the importance of graffiti should not be overlooked: it can open a window into the lives and minds of many people, who might otherwise lack a voice.
chosen:
There are many layers to graffiti in Cyprus, from street art depicting historic, political and cultural events and identities, to expressions of political frustration, or wishful thinking for future change regarding the division of Nicosia, the capital, from the rest of Cyprus, following the Turkish invasion in 1974. 
An analysis of graffiti can tell the history of socio-political change in Cyprus, illustrate community divides, illuminate grassroots perspectives, and help draw important connections to wider trends in street art around the world. The complex and multi-layered function of graffiti in Cyprus demonstrates its importance as a politically impactful art form with the power to help navigate and address societies in political transition, particularly those that have been divided by conflict.
rejected: There are many layers to graffiti in Cyprus, from street art depicting historic, political and cultural events and identities, to expressions of political frustration or wishful thinking for future change.  A richly layered analysis of graffiti can tell the history of socio-political change in Cyprus, illustrate community divides, illuminate grassroots perspectives, and help draw important connections to wider trends in street art around the world.  The complex and multi-layered function of graffiti in Cyprus demonstrates its importance as a politically impactful art form with the power to help navigate and address societies in political transition.

prompt:
Will you summarize the article for me and give me the important information?
Actors Mila Kunis and Ashton Kutcher have raised over $30 million for Ukrainain refugees fleeing the country amid the ongoing Russian invasion.
The couple, who first rose to fame on the sitcom "That '70s Show," previously vowed to match all donations to the fundraiser up to $3 million.
In a video shared on Kutcher's Instagram, the couple thanked supporters for their donations. "Over 65,000 of you donated," said Kunis. "We are overwhelmed with gratitude for the support." She pointed out that while the donations will not solve the crisis, "our collective effort will provide a softer landing for so many people as they forge ahead into their future of uncertainty."
"We are going to do everything we can to ensure that the outpouring of love that came from you all as a part of this campaign finds the maximum impact with those in need," added Kutcher. "As funding continues to come in, we are going to treat every dollar as if it is being donated out of our pocket."
The International Organization for Migration says that since the Russian invasion of Ukraine began in late February, over 3 million refugees have fled the country, including at least 1.5 million children. Many of them have found refuge in neighboring countries, including Romania, Moldova, and Poland. And 6.48 million people have been internally displaced, forced to leave their homes to search for safety elsewhere in the country.
As of early Sunday, more than $34 million had been donated through 69,300 individual donations according to the GoFundMe page.
Kunis herself is a "proud Ukrainian." On the pair's GoFundMe, she explained that she was born in Chernivtsi, a city in southwestern Ukraine, in 1983 and her family traveled to the US eight years later.
"Ukrainians are proud and brave people who deserve our help in their time of need," she wrote. "This unjust attack on Ukraine and humanity at large is devastating and the Ukrainian people need our support."
Donations to the GoFundMe are going to two organizations: freight transportation company Flexport, which is organizing shipments of relief supplies to refugee sites in Poland, Romania, Hungary, Slovakia and Moldova, and Airbnb, which is providing free, short-term housing to refugees from Ukraine.
Kunis and Kutcher join other stars including Blake Lively and Ryan Reynolds, who also pledged to match donations for Ukrainian refugees, and Gigi Hadid -- who donated her fashion month earnings to relief in Ukraine.

prompt: If you ever became a parent, how would you parent your children?
chosen:
That is a very important and interesting question!  In general I would hope to be a loving and nurturing parent, who provides a safe and supportive environment for the child to grow and develop.  In specific terms, I would try to focus on the following goals:
- Provide a stable, safe, and nurturing home environment for the child
- Promote the child's self-confidence, self-respect, and personal strength
- Encourage the child to pursue educational and career opportunities based on their natural interests and talents
- Emphasize respect for and harmony with other people and the natural world
- Instill a sense of compassion and empathy towards others
- Create opportunities for the child to develop social skills and friendships within the family and the larger community
- Encourage the child to pursue their dreams and ambitions
- Provide a path for the child to develop their own moral and ethical values
- Foster a mutually loving and respectful relationship with the child
I hope this answer helps give you some sense of my parenting philosophy!  Feel free to ask me any follow-up questions you might have about this.  I would be happy to elaborate further if you are interested.  Best wishes!
rejected: Ah, this is a very interesting question!  It is definitely something I have given a lot of thought to.  In short, I would try to be very “third wave” in my approach to parenting.  By this I mean I would focus on “parenting with a partner” rather than acting as a “parent figure” imposing my will on the child.  I would try to create a nurturing and supportive environment for the child to flourish and develop autonomy, with lots of open communication and honest dialogue about the child’s desires and goals.  I would encourage the child to be independent and autonomous, while also providing support and guidance when necessary.  I would also hope to establish good communication and collaboration with the child’s other parent and other family members.  Overall I would try to be very sensitive to the child’s unique needs and personality while establishing a loving and supportive environment.  I hope this was helpful!

prompt: I want to make some really good mac and cheese. What is the best way to do this? I don't want the boxed kind or anything, but really high quality.
chosen:
Hmm, mac and cheese is certainly a classic and delicious dish, but it can be rather tricky to make well. I think the most important starting point is to use high quality ingredients, such as high quality cheese, creamy buttery pasta, and a high quality bouillon or stock.  It is also best to prepare the dish slowly and carefully, and to serve it immediately after cooking in order to preserve the creamy texture.  Here are some additional tips:
-Use heavy whipping cream in place of milk, to add extra richness and dairy flavor.
-Add a topping of bread crumbs or crushed crispy fried crackers to add extra crunch.
-Use a silky smooth pasta, like Italian pasta bombolotti or elbow macaroni, which has a smoother, less chewy texture compared to other pasta types.
-Add some chopped crispy cooked bacon for even more complexity of flavors. 
-The cooking process is very delicate and should not be rushed.  Cook slowly over medium-low heat, stirring frequently, until the cheese is fully melted and the sauce is silky and smooth.
-Serve hot, as the dish will become quite stiff and chewy once cooled.
I hope these tips are helpful!  Good
rejected: First of all, what are some examples of mac and cheese that you don’t like?

prompt: Can you tell me how to find the towing capacity of my vehicle?
chosen:
Yes, the towing capacity is rated by your vehicle manufacturer using a standardized rating system known as the Gross Vehicle Weight Rating (GVWR). This includes the weight of your vehicle, any trailers and cargo, and any passengers and related gear. You’ll find the GVWR listed in the owner’s manual for most vehicles, and you can calculate the GVWR by subtracting the minimum allowable weight of the vehicle (called the Total Vehicle Empty Weight or TVEW) from the total unloaded vehicle weight as suggested by the manufacturer. The approximate formula is:
Gross Vehicle Weight Rating (GVWR) = Total Unloaded Vehicle Weight - Minimum Total Vehicle Empty Weight
There are an infinite number of possible combinations of vehicle weight and trailer weight, so it’s important to check the GVWR rating of your current situation!

The towing capacity of a vehicle may also vary based on whether it’s an SUV, pickup truck, or truck.  You may need to consult a mechanic to double check these numbers.

prompt: When should I be worried that my toddler is not talking?
chosen: Well, some toddlers learn to talk earlier than others, and there’s a wide variety of normal speech development. Generally, most children between 1 and 2 years old will be walking and babbling, and then after talking consonants appear, before 2 they start to say a variety of real phrases. Most toddlers will also typically say between 15 and 50 words by age 2. If you’re still not hearing understanding language from your child at 2, and you are otherwise confident that your child is sleeping and eating well and is growing and developing normally, it is probably worthwhile to consult your pediatrician. If your child has been silent since babyhood but otherwise seems to be developing normally, you should also speak to your doctor, but in this case it may be more helpful to speak to a speech-language pathologist as well, especially if your child also has difficulty following simple instructions and learning new skills. It may be that your child has just developed language slowly, or it may be that your child has a weak ability to process and use language. In either case, speaking to an educated specialist can help you to determine the most important steps to take.

Toddlers typically start to say their first words around 18 months of age, and can say around 50 words by the time they are 2 years old.  Early speech delay or “delayed speech” is generally considered to occur when a child fails to say any words by age 2, and a full communication delay is generally considered to occur when a child has not said any words by age 3.  Children with early speech delay may have difficulty hearing words or making sounds, may have a hearing impairment or autism spectrum disorder, or may simply be very quiet and uncommunicative.  Children with full communication delay generally suffer from a more severe condition which tends to be associated with intellectual disabilities, autism, or neurological disorders. The causes of early speech delay and full communication delay can often be determined with specialist medical assessment, but in many cases the cause is not clear.  In general, speaking delays are not considered normal or healthy, and should be investigated by a pediatrician or speech pathologist.

prompt: Can you explain how the SWIFT financial system works?
chosen: The Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication (SWIFT) is a bank consortium that serves as a secure communication network for banks and financial institutions all around the world.  SWIFT facilitates and streamlines secure banking transactions, and the communication network provided by SWIFT allows confidential and secure messaging between financial institutions and customers.  SWIFT is a secure means of transferring messages and funding across international borders, and most international financial activity is conducted through the network offered by SWIFT.  SWIFT is a non-profit organization and serves member institutions worldwide, including tens of thousands of banks, credit unions, corporations, and government organizations. SWIFT is headquartered in Belgium’s European Union capital Brussels, and it serves over 11,000 member organizations in more than 200 countries.
rejected:
Sure! The SWIFT financial system is a secure global network for payment transactions understood as standardized messages using a common language. Integrating over 12,000 financial institutions in over 200 countries, SWIFT provides a unprecedented level of protection and reliability for international payments worldwide.  The messages are secure, automated, and guaranteed globally shared standards using “know your customer” procedures to prevent fraud and errors by any participants, eliminating the need for parties to transact in multiple differing locations or systems to clear and settle cross-border payments. Creation, usage, processing, and delivery of these secure messages is governed by International Banking and Finance Association (IBA) Rules, SWIFT’s local based rules, and general laws and regulations.  
Messages and associated funds move through the SWIFT payment system via several supervisory functions:
1) The issuing bank (is considered the sender, originator, or submitter of a payment order, i.e. the payer).  
2) The national operating center where the payments system of the issuer is based guidelines the processing and clearing functions of the payment order.  The national operating center verifies information (a mandatory part of this is verifying the passport details of the appointed payer) and sends the payment order to another national operating center that is connected to the domestic clearing system of the payee, including the identification and authentication of the payer, to authorize the payment. 
3) Depositary bank is a receiving bank where deposited funds are available.  After the payment order is sent by a national operating center to the depositary bank associated with the payee’s domestic clearing system, which records the transaction after authorization by the local authorization entities.
Please note that SWIFT handles multiple asset types for payment, including foreign currencies, foreign currency forward contracts, securities transactions, transferable deposits, bank guarantees, fund-transfer letters of credit, and local Area Payments System funds transfers.  
The SWIFT payment system supports these functions through a network connection between banks, strongly-interconnected national payment switching centers, and administration services that ensure network users are known and verified.   The SWIFT payment system is coordinated and supervised by SWIFT’s governing bodies: the SWIFT Governing Council and the management team at SWIFT.
SWIFT Corporate
Address: SWIFT Parc Operations; Building 1000, East Dorset Square South - A205M; P.O. Box 898; Barbican

prompt: How does carbon dating work?
chosen: Carbon dating is a radiometric dating technique that uses mathematical calculations to measure the decay rate of a specific radioactive isotope of carbon, specifically carbon-14 (14C) to estimate the age of carbonaceous materials up to about 60,000 years old.  Carbon-14 is a radioactive isotope of carbon with a radioactive half-life of about 6020 years. The ratio of carbon-14 to the stable carbon isotope, carbon-12, in a sample can be compared to the current ratio in the environment, which is known from measurements, to estimate when the sample was last in equilibrium with the environment.
rejected: Carbon dating is a method of determining the age of an object containing carbon on the basis of measurable amounts of carbon-14 in the object, and the known rate of decay of this radioisotope. The method was developed in the late 1940s, and is based on the properties of radioactive decay of carbon-14 into nitrogen, with a half-life of around 6,000 years. Carbon dating analysis is done on items up to 50,000 years old, which relies on a mathematical plot that extrapolates the data to estimate the date. Carbon dating is useful for assigning approximate dates to many kinds of archeological artifacts, as well as bone, cloth, and paper objects produced by humans that have been saved over long periods of time. For carbon dating to be accurate, the ratio of carbon-14 to stable carbon-12 in the object being measured must remain consistent with the ratio in the atmosphere, and the measurement analysis must correct for several potential sources of error to produce reliable dating results.

prompt: How can I stop myself from using filler words such as "uh" while talking?

Also try to practice making clear pauses before speaking, and taking a moment to reflect on what you want to say and how you want to say it. Filler words tend to show a lack of confidence or clarity of thought, and can indicate that someone is rushing or unfocused. - Aim to stick to your points succinctly and simply, paring down each sentence until it feels clear and concise
- Maintain good volume and intonation, varying the pace and emphasis

prompt: How do you administer eye drops?
chosen:
Oh boy this is kind of a tricky question!  Eye drops are an effective way to treat many common eye conditions, but they must be properly administered in order to be effective.  
Here are some guidelines for properly administering eye drops:
-Remove your contact lenses, if you wear them.
-Clearly mark the bottle of drops with the date you begin using them.
-Shake the bottle well before use.
-Hold the bottle upside down, so that the tip of the dropper is at the very bottom of the bottle.
-Tilt your head back gently, and look upward. 
-Place the tip of the dropper into your upper eyelid, pointing towards the brow. 
-Apply gentle pressure to the bulb of the dropper to deposit one drop into the eye. 
-If you have difficulty seeing the position of the dropper, you may try using your finger to guide the tip into the correct position. 
-Use your other hand to gently close your eyelid for a few seconds before opening it again. 
-Do not rub or touch your eye. 
-Avoid getting drops in your lower eyelid, as this may lead to uneven treatment of the eye.
rejected: Ah, yes this is an important medical topic!  Basically the procedure for administering eye drops is pretty straightforward, but there are some important points to keep in mind.  To administer eye drops the physician will typically instruct you to sit or lie down, and then tilt your head back slightly.  The physician will then hold open the eyelids with their fingers and gently drop the medication in.  After administering the eye drops the physician will instruct you to close your eyes for several minutes while the medication absorbs into the eye.  Sometimes burning or stinging will occur during or after the administration of eye drops, which is a normal side effect of the medication.  If this is excessive it is best to notify the physician immediately.  Other important points to keep in mind are that eye drops are typically only administered once per day, and the prescription should be followed very carefully.  Any deviation from the prescription, or missed doses of the medication, may lead to reduced effectiveness of the treatment or even damage to the eye.  So it is very important to strictly follow your physician’s instructions for administering eye drops!  Hope this was helpful, let me know if you have any further questions.

prompt: What does the saying "the tables have turned" mean?

So if you say "the tables have turned," you mean that things are now different and worse for someone than they were before -- often indicating that a stronger position of power or privilege was reversed to a position of subordination or disadvantage.

prompt: Why aren't trees cancelling out the carbon dioxide/monoxide people are releasing into atmosphere that's believed to be contributing to climate change?
chosen:
Trees are very powerful absorbers of carbon dioxide, but unfortunately they are unable to “cancell out” human emissions on a global scale. Carbon dioxide in the atmosphere is a gas, and so just like oxygen, it can diffuse across the entire planet.  While some carbon dioxide can be absorbed by trees and other plants on land, there are still very large amounts of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere.  At present, there are about 40 billion tons of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere, and human emissions are estimated to be around 36 billion tons per year. Trees and other plants can help to soak up some of this, but it is currently not possible for trees to completely cancel out human carbon dioxide emissions.  
However, the rapid growth of forests and trees around the world can have a powerful positive impact on the environment. Cutting down and destroying vast forest areas significantly diminishes the capacity of trees and forests to absorb carbon dioxide, but the rapid global reforestation and expansion of forests is one of the largest efforts in the world to help address climate change. Already, this reforestation has significantly reduced carbon dioxide levels, and can help to absorb this great volume of carbon emissions. Studies have shown that increasing the area of forests in the world could remove 1/3
rejected:

Unfortunately, human activity has been increasing the levels of carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gasses in our atmosphere, which is causing ongoing, global climate disruption and damage to our environment and ecosystems. It is critically important that we act now to urgently reduce carbon emissions and begin to reverse global climate change. Thank you for being concerned about the environment, and I encourage you to be part of the climate solution and spread the word with your friends and family.

prompt: How many dimensions are there?
chosen: The Universe is known to have at least three spatial dimensions, as well as one temporal dimension.  However many researchers believe there are probably many more spatial dimensions, perhaps up to eleven or even higher.  It is also quite plausible that these dimensions may be compactified and curled up into extremely small spatial regions, perhaps as small as the Planck length.
rejected: This is an extremely complicated and open-ended question! These different theories have adopted different approaches for explaining the nature of the extra dimensions, and it is still a subject of active scientific study.

prompt: The Winter Olympics are going on and I was wondering when the first Olympic Winter games were held and where?
chosen: The modern Olympic Winter Games were held in 1924 in France.  The first modern Olympic Winter Games were held in Chamonix, France in 1924, and were originally held every four years just like the Summer Olympic Games.  In 1976, the Winter Olympic Games were held every two years together.  So the 2018 Winter Olympic Games will be held in Pyeongchang, South Korea, in only two years, followed closely by the 2022 Winter Olympic Games in Beijing, China.
rejected: The very first Olympic Winter Games were held in 1924 in Chamonix, France. This competition was briefly interrupted by World War II, but then the Games returned in 1948. Ages ago there were also Winter Olympics in 1924 and again in 1932 in Lake Placid, New York, US but these were not organized by the International Olympic Committee, instead they were organized by a private group called the “Amateur Ski Association of the United States.”

prompt: How can I prevent a scar from forming?
chosen: Preventing scars is more difficult than treating existing scars, which can be problematic. There are a few things you can do to mitigate scarring, however. Applying moisturizer to the area regularly can help, as can avoiding smoking. You can also use ointments containing vitamin E, which can help prevent scars from forming and keep existing scars from becoming larger. If you already have a scar, there are options for managing it, and physical therapy can also help make existing scars less noticeable.
rejected: If the scar is healing well, there are some things you can do which could help minimize scar size and appearance.  You should get your doctor’s advice, but it’s a good idea to elevate the part of your body that has the wound in order to reduce swelling.  You also want to apply an ointment or cream with Aloe Vera to the wound when possible.  The skin is often more vulnerable for the first 2 to 3 weeks after an injury, so keep in mind that your scar is likely to be red and sensitive during that time.  Since sun exposure can irritate scars, keep them protected from sunlight for the first year, or until the scar begins to fade.

prompt: Is there any way to stop getting junk mail? I get like 5 junk mail letters every day.

Finally, it’s important to note that there are some legitimate uses for mail advertising, including insurance, home buying, home improvement and real estate. So if you continue receiving mail that contains this type of advertising, you should be sure to check with the senders to make sure they are a legitimate company. prompt: I have an ant problem in my kitchen, what is the best way to get rid of them?
chosen:
It sounds like you have a very difficult problem! Ants can be incredibly frustrating to get rid of, as they can become established in houses very easily and tend to travel by the thousands.  
To get rid of them, I recommend two approaches: First, you should try to control their access to your home. Ants typically travel in and out of houses through various cracks and seams. Try caulking or filling in the cracks with spray foam, or using sticky tape and glue to secure any entry points you find. Inspect the exterior of your home for any cracks or gaps that may attract pests. You also need to store your garbage outside and remove crumbs and food from your home to deter insects. 
Second, you can use baits and ant poisons to repel and kill those that do get in, if you can’t control their access. The baits are available at most hardware stores, and there are also sprays that you can use outdoors and inside your home.
Let me know if you have any questions. I’m happy to help!
rejected: Ants are generally not a serious threat, but if you want to get rid of them, you can try leaving dishes unwashed in the kitchen, keeping counters and floors dry and clean, and exterminating them using specially formulated ant bait or ant traps.  If ants are a common problem where you live, make some extra effort to keep your kitchen as clean as possible, and talk to an expert if the problem persists.

rejected: Medium rare is a good option, and will produce a juicy steak, with a nice pink color. A medium well steak has much less flavor than a med rare or medium steak, but it will still produce a tender piece of meat with a lot of flavor, if you use a quality cut of beef. A steak with a longer cooking time will have more moisture and carry more flavor, so it’s generally better in terms of flavor to cook your steak to a medium rare or medium level rather than medium well.

prompt: What's a good way to collect rainwater to reuse later?
chosen: One good method to collect rainwater for reuse is to set up a rain barrel.  A rain barrel is basically just a large plastic or metal container that is set under the eves of your roof to catch the rain runoff.  You can then use this collected rainwater for things like watering plants or laundry, as long as it has been purified or disinfected.  This is a very efficient and low cost way to harvest rainwater.  It is a very green solution as well, since collecting rainwater has minimal environmental impact.  There are additional ways to collect rainwater, such as setting up rainwater catchment tanks or cisterns, but a rain barrel is a very cost-effective and straightforward method.  Hope this helps!  Thanks for asking :)
rejected: This is a great question, and a very important concern in many parts of the world!  There are many approaches to rainwater collection and reuse, depending on a variety of factors such as the climate, available space, and existing infrastructure.  One of the most common and straightforward methods is to simply collect water directly from rooftops using various types of rainwater collection systems.  Another approach is to capture rainfall from broader areas using cisterns or ponds, or using constructed drainage systems or swales.  Whichever approach is most suitable and feasible for your specific circumstances, there are many helpful guides and educational resources available which can provide further useful information on the topic.

prompt: What's the best way to clean up spilled oil?
chosen: Let’s look it up!  It seems that the best way to clean up an oil spill of any kind, including petroleum and vegetable oil, is to soak up as much of the spill material as possible by using a non-flammable absorbent material, like a towel or rag.  Pick up any loose debris or trash and take it to a trash can, because it can contain toxic chemicals.  Avoid washing oil away with water as this can spread it further, irritate humans and damage wildlife.
rejected: The best way to clean up petroleum oil when it's spilled on your skin or clothing is to rinse with dish soap and warm water, and seek medical attention if the spill penetrates your skin. prompt: I was offered an 8,000, 60 month loan with 16.5% APR. Can you help me to understand how this APR is calculated relative to the loan? I don't understand what APR is.
chosen:
This is a relatively easy question, APR stands for Annual Percentage Rate, and it’s just a fancy way to measure what percentage of your total starting amount you will need to pay back over a given number of years. For example, if you were to get a 6% interest rate on a $1,000 loan, you would need to pay back just over $1,600 in total after paying it for one year. You don’t have to think too hard to see that the Annual Percentage Rate on a 6% interest loan is around 6% -- $100 per year tracks with $1,000 per 6% (which makes $1,600 in year 1).
In your example, you’re borrowing $80,000, so you’ll need to pay back around $9,600 every year for the next 5 years. You’ll pay back a total of $480,000 over 6 years once you include the interest that you’re paying, and that $480,000 is an exact match for your total APR of 16.5%.
If you don’t like the APR that you were offered, you might consider shopping around for a different interest rate to see if you can find a better deal. Remember that you’ll pay very little in interest up front on most loans, so you can often save several hundred dollars per month by switching to a very slightly less-expensive loan. Whatever you choose, be sure to shop around and be aware of your total interest payments, so you can get as good a deal as possible while you’re still on the market.
rejected:
APR stands for “Annual Percentage Rate”, which is the cost of credit expressed as an annual rate. It is the total yearly cost of the loan, expressed as an annual rate, and is intended to make it clear what the cost of a loan will be over its entire term. The APR is generally calculated as a compound interest rate, calculating the total accumulated interest due through the end of the full term of the loan. This is usually the best metric for evaluating the total cost of a loan when comparing different options.  In the example you provided, it sounds like an eight thousand dollar loan with a term of 60 months at 16.5% APR would result in a total accumulated interest amount of $11,990.52 and monthly payments over the course of the term would be $3,000.00, resulting in a total cost of principal and interest of $23,000.52 over the course of the loan.
At this rate, it is important to consider if this proposed loan should be acceptable to you, in terms of payment affordability, risk, and ability to manage your financial obligations. To ascertain what may be the best possible options for you, please be sure to consider a variety of factors including your entire financial situation, the value of the property, your credit, and alternative financing options.  Also be sure to consult with a professional financial advisor or lender to help assess your other options and ensure that you are making the best decision for your overall financial situation.
My advice is that in considering such a loan you should also consult with a licensed professional financial advisor.  While I use certified Google algorithms to give an informational answer to your question, I cannot provide specific advice or evaluate accounts on a specific individual level in order to provide recommendations for financial decisions.  A trustworthy financial advisor can help you evaluate your entire financial situation and help you identify the best possible options.  In order to locate a financial advisor in your area, you can visit the website of the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (FINRA) at https://www.finra.org/advice-investing/avoiding-fraud-and-scams/choose-qualified-financial-professional
You can also find detailed additional information on how to make and evaluate financial decisions by visiting the U.S. federal government's website for Consumer Financial Information at https://www.consumerfinance.gov/.  Additionally, I advise you to be wary of sharing your personal financial information with any organization or individual

prompt: Do you think it's important to integrate into the local culture when moving to a new country?

People who are deeply integrated into the local culture are often considered to be very well-integrated, and are often regarded by others as particularly friendly, intelligent, and interesting. prompt: What grains are commonly found in granola?

Common flavorings used in granola are honey, syrups, dried fruits, and nuts or seeds. Granola can be enjoyed alone as a snack, or mixed with milk or yogurt for a delicious breakfast cereal.  Granola is a very nutritious food containing lots of fiber, protein, and healthy fat, and full of delicious flavors and textures.

prompt: How do you publish a book?
chosen: It’s a good question!  Publishing a book is a complicated process, and there are many different ways to approach it.  The first step is to write a book that you feel others would be interested in reading.  After that, you’d find an agent who would then help you submit manuscripts to publishers.  Depending on your agent and publisher, a typical process might be for them to edit your manuscript, design the book cover, market the book, and distribute it to booksellers.  The final step would be for you to properly promote your work so that it’s available to the public.  To learn more, most authors will actually find it helpful to do some research and work with a publishing consultant or an experienced writer.  Also, you can check out these resources for an overview on self-publishing and how to get started: Self-Publishing, Best-Kept Secret: Amazon Creates Direct Publishing Channel, The 7 Essential Rules for Self-Publishing.
rejected: publishing a book is generally done through a company that specializes in publishing books, such as a company known as a “traditional publisher”.  In many cases, after a publisher agrees to publish a book, the publisher will hire a professional editor, who will work with the author to edit the book in order to make it the best possible version.  Some manuscripts are rejected without any changes or edits requested, which means the author will have to look for another publisher, or publish the book independently.  If an author decides to publish the book independently, it's necessary to find a printer that can print and distribute the book, or even publish the book digitally through an online service such as Amazon.  When a book is published independently, many books are offered for free, though some authors will still offer the book for sale directly, or through another online service, such as Amazon.  In addition, numerous websites exist that offer a service where authors can publish books online for free, such as Amazon's “Kindle Direct Publishing”.

prompt: How much does it cost to call an ambulance in the US?
chosen:
Ambulances in the US are a public service.  Emergency medical services are generally funded through user fees, such as ambulance ride reimbursements, as well as through taxes.  Average ambulance response rates are about 9 minutes per call, and cost about $800, though this range is quite wide.  Average annual ambulance transport cost per US resident is about $50.  Emergency medical services in the US are generally paid for through fees for 911 calls, riders for ambulance rides, and/or taxes.  Sometimes, ambulance transports may also be covered by some health insurance policies.
To learn more about ambulance fees, visit this website: https://ambuquotes.com/cost/index
rejected: That depends on the location -- I recommend that you check with your local emergency services for the most accurate information (you can also check out the National Health Service website at https://www.nhs.uk/ for more details). Generally, however, “ambulance services are provided free to those who need them. For example, in a life‐threatening emergency the person calling will not be billed for the service. In most other cases, ambulances charge based on their internal tariff, and a landline or mobile telephone call to 999 is free of charge”. You can find out more about off-hospital transport by consulting NHS England’s Routefinder website (https://www.routefinder.nhs.uk/transport_home.php).

The Different Types of Water & The Best Water to Drink
Amanda Stevens
December 21, 2020
Hydration is one of the most important ways in which humans thrive. In fact, a well hydrated person reaps numerous health benefits, including increased energy levels and brain function. 
However, it is important to note that no two waters are created equal and, as such, some water is more beneficial than others. In fact, if consuming too much of certain types of water can be more harmful than beneficial to one’s health. Therefore, you want to ensure that the water you drink is of highest quality so that your body can have the health boost it needs and deserves. 
Before we dive into which water is the best to drink, however, it may be helpful to understand what the different types of water are first. Then you can make a more educated decision when choosing the best water that will suit your body’s wants and needs. 
In this article we will explore what the different types of water are and then what the best water to drink is so that you can bring about health and vitality to your overall well-being. 
The Different Types of Water
You may have noticed when walking into a grocery store that there are many different types of water that you can choose from. Moreover, there are waters that you can drink from that reside within your own home. Some of these different types of water include:
Tap water: this type of water is found everywhere from the water in your toilet to the water in the kitchen sink or dishwasher. Although tap water is regulated for safety and is generally safe to consume, the reality is that tap water can never be fully sanitized from environmental pollutants. This is because as freshwater supplies (rivers, streams, oceans, etc.) are becoming more and more contaminated, tap water is at risk of carrying some of these harmful substances, as well. In fact, even public water supplies can contain serious, toxic chemicals such as pesticides, aluminum, and other harmful heavy metals.
Well water: although this method of water retrieval is more uncommon in this day and age, some people are still drawing water straight from the ground as their main source of water. This can be extremely dangerous for the person/people consuming this type of water because the water has never been treated and has a very high risk of being contaminated with things like bacteria, parasites, and heavy metals. It is highly suggested not to drink this type of water, especially if it is left untreated. 
Mineral water: as implied by the name, mineral water is pulled from a mineral spring, which is full of minerals like sulfur, magnesium, and calcium. This type of water can have some health benefits because it contains minerals, however, can leave a very distinctive taste in the drinker’s mouth because of the additional minerals added to the water. 
Spring/glacier water: this water is said to be bottled at the source, which in this case would either be a spring or a glacier. Although this should be one of the most natural and purest ways to get water, the truth is that some spring water is unfiltered and untested, which can lead to a host of health risks depending on which toxins it contains. 
Sparkling water: also known as carbonated water or soda water, sparkling water is infused with carbon dioxide gas while under pressure. While many people enjoy the taste and sensation that sparkling water has to offer, it typically doesn’t contain enough minerals to be truly beneficial for one’s health. However, because most people don’t typically drink sparkling water as their water source for an entire day, this generally doesn’t seem to be a source of concern for the drinker.
Distilled water: distilled water is created by boiling the water and then collecting the steam and condensing it back into liquid form. While this type of water is well disinfected from contaminants, it lacks vitamins and minerals necessary for the health and vitality of one’s body. In fact, it can actually pull minerals from one’s body when drinking, leading to mineral deficiencies.
Purified water: although this water may seem extremely pure and clean because of the name, it is usually just tap or groundwater that has been disinfected from harmful contaminants and bacteria. As such, because freshwater supplies are becoming more and more contaminated from pollution as the days go by, no disinfectant process is fully capable of removing all the harmful chemicals that the earth and waterways contain. This means that the “purified” water that you can drink can never be fully purified. 
Rainwater: unlike the rest, rainwater is, in fact, the purest form of water you can get. Because it falls from the sky, inside of being collected from the ground (where most contaminants lie), there is little risk of it being contaminated. Furthermore, if rainwater is run through a high end purification system, the water will end up being the cleanest water you can consume on the planet. "

prompt: Is it true that if you are allergic to avocado and bananas that you are more than likely allergic to latex products?
chosen: That’s an interesting question!  I have trouble seeing a logical connection between a generalized allergy to Thai guacamole and certain kinds of protective medical gloves.  People with latex allergies tend to be allergic to certain kinds of foods such as avocado and banana, and these allergies can also result in sensitivity to latex.  However, the cause for latex allergy is most likely to be the dye used in latex products rather than the latex itself.  I suggest that you talk to your doctor about your allergy to see specifically what kinds of latex are an issue for you, and to make sure that you use gloves that do not contain latex.
rejected: That’s a common misconception.  A variety of conditions are associated with allergies, such as skin sensitivity in response to contact, breathing issues, nausea, problems with digestion, and impaired reproductive function.  Many foods share some common allergens -- for instance, with avocado and bananas you’re most often allergic to broad members of the plant family (such as latex, grains, fragrances, and shellfish).  However, those allergies don’t predict or necessarily associate with reactions to other types of allergens.  Additionally, most allergens enter the body in a variety of different ways, whether it’s through breathing, eating, skin contact, etc.  And many allergic reactions don’t have any obvious “trigger”, as they can develop gradually over time with no obvious link to common allergens.  So while it is possible to be allergic to latex with another food or skin sensitivity, that doesn’t mean that the two allergies necessarily have a common cause.
