prompt: Would you be able to write a paragraph for a Non Disclosure Agreement please?
chosen:
Here is a sample paragraph. Please keep in mind that this language is meant to serve only as a guideline and that specific NDA language should be drawn up by a lawyer familiar with all applicable local, state, and national requirements for any specific NDA.
I, ______, (hereinafter known as "Party A") and _____ (hereinafter known as “Party B”) agree to the following non-disclosure terms.
1. ALL PERSONAL AND PROPRIETARY INFORMATION
Parties A and B both expressly agree that all visits, interviews, meetings, and discussions conducted shall remain confidential. This restriction to confidentiality shall also apply to all communications, including emails, text messages, phone calls, and any form of written materials, within the context of such visits, interviews, meetings, and discussions. Neither Party shall disclose or cause the disclosure of Confidential Information obtained from the other Party to anyone.
2. CONFIDENTIAL AND PROPRIETARY INFORMATION TO US ONLY
All Confidential Information (as defined below) is solely owned or used by Party A and its Affiliates (collectively hereinafter referred to as the “Owners”). It is not intended for disclosure to anyone other than Party B and its Representatives (as defined below), except in circumstances where prior written consent of the Owners has been obtained.
Definitions and Uses of Confidential Information
1. Confidential Information shall mean any and all confidential or proprietary material or information of which Party B obtained knowledge from Party A or its Representatives. "Confidential Information" includes, but is not limited to, the terms and conditions of any contract, business plans, programs, processes, products, information, systems, proposals, financial information, strategic plans, business forecasts, pricing systems, revenue and sales information, and leasing information of any kind.
2. Confidential Information shall include all non-public information relating to the Owners' past, present or future business operations, including but not limited to the following products and services: ______.
3. Unless otherwise defined, all terms and definitions used in this NDA also apply to the Confidential Information disclosed under this NDA.  All confidential information shall remain confidential throughout the term of this NDA and the exclusivity period (as defined below), as well as beyond such period. Confidential Information shall not be disclosed, or knowingly permitted to be seen or used by anyone else, in any form whatsoever, except as disclosed under specific written consent.  Confidential information shall be interpreted very broadly to include all information not generally known outside of business operations and existing proprietary processes (such as marketing,analytical and technological methods), including all records, reports, data, files, price lists, equipment specifications, software programs, cost details, marketing details, strengths, weaknesses, prices, financial projections, scientific, technical and engineering information, methods and processes, and plans relating to research, development, sale or commercial use of Party A or any Affiliate products, services and operations. Confidential information shall not include any information that (i) is publicly available at the time of disclosure; (ii) becomes publicly available through no act or omission of the receiving party; (iii) was rightfully in the possession of the receiving party prior to disclosure by Party A or a lawful representative of Party A; or (iv) was rightfully furnished to the Receiving Party by a third party having rights to disclose such information.
4. Disclosure to Party B’s Representatives shall mean party B's executive management and employees including, but not limited to, all officers, directors, employees, advisors, consultants, joint venture participants, agents, shareholders, members, representatives, agents and or affiliate companies of any kind that subsequently joined organization following the term of this NDA.
5. In addition, both parties expressly agree that no implied or additional rights exist beyond those specifically stated in this NDA.
3. CONFIDENTIALITY AND ACKNOWLEDGMENT
1. Both Parties shall maintain the confidentiality of Confidential Information as strictly confidential and shall make no disclosure or use of Confidential Information to anyone other than as expressly authorized or required in connection with, or within the scope of, its employment or in accordance herewith, or as required in order to comply with any applicable law, governmental regulation or judicial process, or pursuant to any governmental authority and only in strict compliance with the terms of this NDA; provided, however, that either Party may disclose Confidential Information to the extent required by reason of the receipt of a valid subpoena or other legal process, provided that Party is required by law or such subpoena or other legal process to do so. Disclosure or use otherwise prohibited by any of the provisions of this Section 3 shall be deemed to have occurred if any Confidential Information, or any part thereof, is disclosed, provided to, or communicated, in any manner, to any person by any means, and in any written, oral or electronic form.
2. Party A and its Representatives shall use the Confidential Information only as is necessary in connection with the intended purpose of this Agreement and shall be responsible for all the acts or omissions of its employees, agents and subcontractors. Party B and its Representatives shall not disclose any Confidential Information of Party A or any Affiliate to others and shall hold such other parties subject to the same confidentiality obligations, restrictions and prohibitions that apply to Party B.
4. TERM
The term of this NDA shall begin on the effective date and shall end on the fifth anniversary (the “Term”).  The term of this NDA shall be automatically renewed for successive five (5) years thereafter unless Party A gives prior written notice to Party B of the intention not to renew at least one (1) year before the effective date of non-renewal.  Party B agrees that at the termination or expiration of this Agreement, it shall return all Confidential Information to Party A and all other confidential material or property of Party A (or alternatively, destroy all Confidential Information and certify in writing that Party B has destroyed all Confidential Information, then and in either event, certify that it has complied with its obligations under this section of the Agreement).
5. CONFIDENTIALITY OBLIGATIONS DURING AND AFTER THIS AGREEMENT
On the effective date of this Agreement and for the term of this Agreement and after the term expires, Party A and its Representatives and all of its and their employees, agents and subcontractors shall hold the Confidential Information in strict confidence and will not make any disclosure or use of the Confidential Information other than in accordance with the purpose and terms of this Agreement. Party B and its Representatives and all of its and their employees, agents and subcontractors shall hold the Confidential Information in strict confidence and will not make any disclosure or use of the Confidential Information other than in accordance with the purpose and terms of this Agreement. With respect to any Confidential Information of which Party B becomes aware or to which it becomes privy, Party B shall maintain the same treatment, until all said Confidential Information terminates, expires or is released in accordance with this Agreement or the law.
6. TRADE SECRETS"
All Confidential Information shall be deemed to be "trade secrets" and information deemed "trade secrets" shall for purposes of this Agreement also be "confidential" information. In addition to its other obligations, Party B will undertake all reasonable efforts to maintain the Confidential Information strictly confidential and will not use Confidential Information for any purpose other than in furtherance of its obligations to Party A. Confidential Information may not be used for any purpose other than for internal use and future business alliance, cooperation and developments. Party A and its Representatives shall not independently develop any undisclosed equivalent or competitive technology or product. If Party B becomes aware, through its development efforts, that there are areas in the Confidential Information violating Section 9 (Proprietary Rights), Party B will immediately cease and inhibit such activities and will immediately notify Party A.
7. DISCLAIMER OF WARRANTIES AND LIMITATION OF LIABILITY
All Confidential Information is provided to Party B "AS-IS," "WITH ALL FAULTS" and it is understood that Party A is not making any commitment, representations, or warranties about its adequacy, quality, accuracy, reliability, completeness, design, performance, merchantability, technical content, functionality, operation or maintenance and accordingly Party A shall in no way be liable for any damages, direct or indirect, where such liability could arise from the use of or inability to use any Confidential Information or other results caused by using or
rejected:
Absolutely.  A Non Disclosure Agreement (or “NDA”) is a legal document that protects trade secrets and other confidential information.  In general, it prohibits various parties from sharing, discussing, or using confidential, sensitive information created during certain types of business dealings.  NDAs can be useful for situations when two parties are developing new ideas, or when one party shares potentially sensitive or valuable information with another party.
An NDA typically has strict rules for confidentiality, and typically includes clauses that prohibit sharing confidential information, copying it, or discussing it with other parties.  Violation of an NDA can carry serious consequences, and may result in a lawsuit or fine, depending on the circumstances.
NDAs typically target specific types of information, and impose a restricted period in which confidential information must be kept confidential.  This period may be a short period of one or two years, or it may be longer.  Legal questions about NDAs vary widely by jurisdiction, so it is always a good idea to review your local laws to ensure that an NDA is a legal document in your case.
NDAs may be signed by either written or electronic means.  When an NDA is signed through an electronic means, the signing party typically taps or clicks on visual cues to indicate their consent, pushes buttons to complete the process, and forwards the electronic document via email or a link to the other party.  As with any legal document, it is always a good idea to seek legal assistance if you are unsure how to proceed with an NDA. prompt: What is bananas foster and how can I make it at home?
chosen: Bananas Foster is a dish made with bananas, sugar, brown sugar, butter, and dark rum.  It’s typically burned on top with a set of kitchen torches, which adds a special flavoring and produces a very delicious dessert.  To make banana foster at home yourself, start by whipping 1/3 cup of butter, 2/3 cup dark brown sugar, and a generous pinch of salt in a medium pan over medium heat.  When the butter has melted, add 3 or 4 bananas, cut into 1-inch thick slices.  Cook for about 10 minutes, or until the bananas are soft.  Add 2 tbsp. of dark rum, a pinch of cinnamon, and a pinch of nutmeg, and cook for 2-3 minutes more, until the seasoning and alcohol have been absorbed by the bananas.  Sprinkle 2 tbsp. of peanuts on top, and continue to cook for another few minutes, until the peanuts are soft.  Finally, use a kitchen torch to flame the top of the dish, slightly tilting the pan to evenly flame the bananas on top.  Serve immediately, and enjoy!
rejected: Bananas Foster is an often-caramelized dessert that’s made by combining bananas, dark rum, and brown sugar, and then cooking until it’s caramelized and flambéed.  It’s a classic French dessert and can be found at many fine restaurants.  Here’s a basic recipe if you’d like to try making it at home: https://www.nytimes.com/recipes/1018046

prompt: How can I conquer a fear of heights?
chosen:
People with a fear of heights often feel a sense of panic or dread when exposed to high elevations, especially at great heights above the ground. Common strategies other people have found to be effective in overcoming this fear include: 
-Desensitization: gradual exposure to higher and higher heights, with careful monitoring of anxiety level
-Cognitive behavioral therapy: challenging irrational ideas about heights, such as “I will fall off the edge”, and replacing with more realistic ideas about heights, such as “the ledge or railing is very strong and will prevent me from falling”
-Deep breathing and other calming techniques
-Maintaining a positive, confident mindset
-Relearning skills or taking new actions that counteract the fear, such as climbing or hiking
-Using medications that have been specifically approved for the treatment of fear of heights
-In rare cases, surgical treatments involving deep brain stimulation 
Overall the most effective treatment is a multi-faceted approach which combines several of these strategies.  I hope this information is helpful to you, please let me know if you have any further questions!

-  Use progressive desensitization techniques to overcome the fear gradually, by faced your fears in smaller and smaller doses 
-  Use exposure and response prevention therapy, which involves actively facing your fears in a safe environment with the help of a therapist.  
-  Learn specific coping strategies and practices for managing your anxiety in high-stress situations, such as breathing exercises, relaxation techniques, and positive self-talk 
-  Learn about the physiologic arousal response underlying your fear, and practice effective ways of calming this response such as deep breathing or progressive muscle relaxation.  
-  Develop a positive mindset by reminding yourself that you CAN overcome your fear, and that your fear is irrational and unrealistic.  Remind yourself that most of the time you are perfectly fine with high places, and that high places are perfectly safe and you have nothing to fear.

Overall I would say that parrots are a good pet choice, but they require a lot of care and attention, so they are best suited for owners with experience caring for birds, and who are comfortable with a very social and chatty pet.

prompt: Can you outline Mao Tse Tung principle on, no investigation, no right to speak?
chosen:
Mao Zedong strongly advocated for strict adherence to his political ideologies in Communist China, called Maoism, which followed the communist principles of Marxism-Leninism.  The principle on which no investigation, no right to speak was based is reflected in several key texts, including Mao Tse Tung's "Problems of Strategy in China’s Revolutionary War" and "The Domestic War'”:
"In any state or any party, no matter how big and strong it may be, if it tolerates or neglects differences of opinion, it will be overthrown sooner or later ... Therefore all comrades must know how to think independently and see clearly both the white and dark sides of a problem, and to criticize and criticize, criticize both Party policy and their own work, both class struggle and class collaboration. In order to oppose dogmatism and narrow-mindedness, we must devote all our efforts to the criticism of each other's thoughts."
Mao stressed the necessity of criticism and investigation to weed out ideological and political impurities in communist principles. Similarly, Maoists stressed the crucial importance of ideological purity in adhering to these principles, and explicitly exercised strong ideological censorship in the media and education systems.
rejected: Mao Tse Tung did not allow any criticisms or public discussions of various political and social issues or policies, and the government was supreme and clear in this authoritarian approach.  All public statements and investigations were highly regulated and restricted, similar to an official party line that could not be challenged.  Debate and discussion among the public was strictly controlled and censored, which meant that the party leadership made all critical decisions and had full control over all public communications.  This strict system of censorship and control, known as “mind control”, was designed to eliminate any questions or opposition, so that there could be no public challenge to the official party administration.

prompt: What is the placebo effect, and how powerful is it believed to be?
chosen: The placebo effect is the measurable improvement in symptoms or efficacy that results from a given medication or treatment, even though there is no known pharmacological or therapeutic effect of the treatment administered.  The placebo effect is believed to be moderately powerful, as in many cases around 30% of patients treated with inactive or “fake” pills show statistically significant improvement. It is also believed that the placebo effect is strongest for more subjective, self-reported symptom measures, like pain, anxiety, depression, and other such psychological outcomes.
rejected:
The placebo effect is the phenomenon in which patients experience a perceived or actual improvement in their condition that is not caused by a medication, treatment, or other intervention, but by the power of belief or suggestion. This effect is widely recognized in medicine, and is generally considered to be functional with regards to many natural or common medical treatments and medications, and ideally occurs due to the actions of neurochemicals like endorphins, dopamine, serotonin, and norepinephrine as neuronal pathways are activated in the brain. Various studies indicate that placebo effects occur in roughly 30% of patients with common diseases, and can be quite powerful in the reduction of symptoms and potential improvement of outcomes for rapid clinical improvement in many illnesses and conditions that include:

-Most headaches

-Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), Huntington's, Tourette syndrome

-High blood pressure

prompt: Can you write a paragraph on the differences between WiFi and bluetooth technology?
chosen: Sure, I’ll do my best to explain.  Bluetooth technology allows nearby devices to communicate wirelessly, using radio signals to transfer data.   Bluetooth technology is often limited to short-range communication.  For example, many Bluetooth devices, such as keyboards and mice, can only connect to a computer at a close distance.  Bluetooth has other advantages though.  Devices that use Bluetooth are generally less power-consuming than WiFi devices, and can be turned on and off or left on for long periods of time and still be reliable.  WiFi technology will offer greater range than Bluetooth, and is better for large file downloads and for streaming data at high speeds.  WiFi technology can typically connect far-distant devices, but may require a computer or server nearby to be connected to.
rejected: Sure, I would be happy to! I would first like to point out that one of the main differences is that bluetooth technology is often used in headsets and other modems that transmit voice data, while wireless fidelity or WiFi is used in many modern appliances for connecting to the internet or to your router. Bluetooth also sends data extremely quickly, and can be used for things like wireless video streaming, where you may need quick connections.

prompt: What are the biggest exports for the United States?
chosen: The biggest exports from the United States are transportation equipment, industrial machines, fuel, automobiles, aircraft, pharmaceuticals, and electrical equipment. In 2017 the top U.S. exports were aircraft and parts ($89 billion), machinery and transport equipment ($80 billion), industrial machinery ($42 billion), petroleum and petroleum products ($38 billion), computers and electronic products ($36 billion), automotive vehicles, parts, and engines ($34 billion), organic chemicals ($31 billion), pharmaceuticals ($25 billion), plastics and rubber products ($23 billion), electronic components ($22 billion), and agricultural and other food products ($16 billion). Over half of U.S. merchandise exports are accounted for by its top 10 exports, led by aircraft and parts, machinery and transport equipment, automotive vehicles and parts, industrial transport equipment, electrical apparatus, chemical products, miscellaneous manufactured goods, and organic chemicals.
rejected:
The largest exports for the United States include petroleum and methane gas, aircraft, soybeans, motor vehicles, industrial machinery, and electrical equipment.  
As one of the leading industrialized economies in the world, the United States is a major exporter of common consumer goods, machinery, and high technology goods. Export partners of major importance include Canada, the People’s Republic of China, Mexico, Japan, South Korea, United Kingdom, Germany, France, South Africa, Taiwan, and Turkey. In 2018, US exports were estimated at $2.3 trillion USD, while imports totaled $2.7 trillion USD.
When discussing a country’s exports, it’s helpful to consider the country’s international trade balance. The trade balance examines the difference between a country’s exports and imports, and is sometimes referred to as the balance of trade. An exporting nation has a trade surplus when its exports exceed its imports, creating a trade surplus. This trade surplus increases the net worth of the exporting nation in the form of foreign currency reserves. Conversely, an importing nation has a trade deficit when its imports exceed its exports, creating a trade deficit. This trade deficit results in money flowing out of the importing nation to fund trade deficit spending by the importing nation

prompt: Can you explain the OSHA hazardous materials labeling system?
chosen: OSHA, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration, is an organization that helps create safe workplaces for people. The organization has published a set of regulations to help employers identify, store, and label hazardous materials appropriately. The Agency’s Hazard Communication Standard, including a labeling system designed to help workers recognize hazards from these materials, is covered by these regulations. All chemical products are required to be clearly labeled with information about hazards associated with exposure to the product, both general hazards as well as specific information about exposure levels that could produce unwanted health effects. Employers are required to train workers to understand these labels.
rejected: Sure.  The labeling system, which is regulated by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration, or OSHA, provides specific instructions on how to identify hazardous materials and how to correctly label containers of these materials.  The labels contain information such as special storage, transport, and disposal requirements, as well as hazard warnings.

prompt: How do you care for a pine tree?
chosen: There are many different ways to take care of a pine tree.  For example, it is important to really water the soil around the tree consistently throughout each year, especially during the dry months of spring and summer. Pruning the branches to give the tree a strong, circular shape will also stimulate vigorous new growth.  The best time to prune is in the late winter or early spring before the trees start to grow.  You should also feed your tree using a nitrogenous fertilizer in the late fall once the leaves have fallen.  And you can rotate the tree to keep the soil underneath healthy.

prompt: How do doping regulations work in the Olympic games?
chosen: Doping is strictly regulated by the World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA).  Its prohibited substances list covers more than 150 drugs and substances of abuse that can be used for performance enhancement, including stimulants, anabolic steroids, growth hormones, blood boosters, masking agents and peptides. Olympic athletes are subject to rigorous WADA testing programs to detect these substances at all times, including before and during events, as well as during required testing periods after an event.  In cases where a prohibited substance is detected, athletes are required to submit a doping sample for expert testing and analysis in order to prove they have not committed an anti-doping rule violation. Violators face severe penalties including severe suspensions, fine, loss of medals or results, and even in some cases monetary fines or imprisonment.
rejected:
Doping is the use of banned substances or techniques in order to seek athletic advantage or unfair advantage. Doping violations are strictly prohibited in the Olympic games and other international sporting events.  All athletes at the Olympic Games must participate in a doping screen and testing process to ensure that they are competing with a level playing field and on a safe and healthy basis.  Any athlete found to use banned substances in competition is subject to punishment as determined by the International Olympic Committee (IOC).  Doping violations can result in lifetime bans from Olympic events and other international competitions, in addition to significant monetary fines and suspensions.  In accordance with the World Anti-Doping Code, each participating country has a national anti-doping organization that is responsible for implementing its own doping rules, guidelines and regulations.  The United States Olympic Committee National Anti-Doping Organization and all individual National Governing Bodies have policies regarding doping and anti-doping education, standards, athlete responsibility, prevention, detection, and sanctions. For more information, see the following resources: 
-      2017 World Anti-Doping Code
-      2017 USADA Code
-      USADA Athlete Responsibility Code
-      IOC Athlete Biological Passport Policy

prompt: Why don't casinos have clocks?
chosen: Hmm that’s a rather interesting and thought-provoking question! The general consensus is that casinos are designed and operated to maximize profits for the casino operators, and providing clocks in the casinos would present an undesirable disincentive for gambling past a certain point.  Casinos also seek to foster a sense of timelessness and escapism within the casino environment, which helps to maintain the sense of thrill and excitement within the casinos.  Therefore, casinos are typically deliberately designed to be somewhat deliberately counter-intuitive and disorienting, with no clocks or windows, and to provide an endless flow of distraction and entertainment to keep gamblers engaged and spending time and money within the casinos.
rejected: That is a common misconception, actually casinos do have clocks.  Casinos typically have hundreds of clocks prominently displayed in the casinos to orient players and staff regarding time and scheduling, for the purpose of increasing fairness and maintaining responsible betting habits. Clocks are often used as design features in casinos for a deliberate aesthetic effect related to the perception of time, and are intended to create a sense of adventure and excitement as part of the casino experience.  Casinos often feature large clocks above the main entrance, and there are usually many digital clocks and analog clock faces mounted on gaming tables and other prominent locations throughout the casino floor.  A summit held by the American Gaming Association in July 2019 made a statement urging casinos to 1) Establish a casual and equitable environment, 2) Maintain fairness and integrity of game play, 3) Respect the rights of patrons through clarity, honesty and good faith. Part of this includes providing clear visibility of time and scheduling for the purpose of supporting responsible gaming behaviors, and many states have regulations about clock displays in casinos. prompt: Can you explain what 'noob gains' means exactly? From what I understand, its the muscle you put on right when you start lifting weights.
chosen: The phrase “noob gains” is a slang term that is often used to refer to muscle gains that come from weightlifting but are shallow or fleeting, as opposed to “real gains” that are from using more challenging exercises and lifting heavier weights over time. Basically, it’s a way to describe the way in which people who start using weightlifting exercise often make initial gains in muscle mass before starting to plateau after only a few weeks or months.
rejected: Sure noob gains aren't technically muscle, but are a temporary increase in strength people experience at the start of a new training program. They're easiest to notice in people who are brand new to weightlifting, but can happen to even experienced lifters if their training has been interrupted or changed. Noob gains generally go away after a year or so in a steady training routine, but temporary gains don't necessarily mean that a lot of muscle growth is occurring. Instead, your body brings other systems into play to support an increase in strength, and many noob gains happen through an improvement in neural (brain and nervous system) activity. One way to keep the gains is, of course, to keep training consistently!

prompt: What are some different ice cream flavors I can make?

Vanilla
Vanilla is the most popular flavor for ice cream, and comes in many forms.  Vanilla extract is a liquid version that is usually mixed with other flavors.  Vanilla beans come in a dried pod form, which can be crushed and added to ice cream as well.

Raspberry

Chocolate
Chocolate ice cream is also easy to make

Popular options include chocolate, coffee, caramel, tiramisu, various fruit flavors and combinations, cookies and cream, malts, toffee, peppermint, golden vanilla, marshmallow swirl, rocky road, hip hiperooni, limoncello, eggnog, pina colada, bubblegum, root beer float, brownie, cookies and cream, Belgian waffle, gingersnap, mixed berry, and custard.

prompt: What can you do about loose skin if you can't afford surgery?

Vigorous cardio exercises can help improve blood flow to your skin, helping it maintain its youthful glow. Exercising also increases collagen production, which will increase your skin's firmness and elasticity as you age. prompt: What do you think of the saying that no one really dies until he is forgotten.
chosen: I really like this statement, as it reminds us of the important role that memory plays in human society and psychology.  Indeed many people strive to create lasting memories of loved ones after they have passed, and the phenomenon of “remembering the forgotten” has become an important social issue in recent years.  I generally agree with the sentiment of this saying, that there is a sense in which those who have truly made an impact on society, or strongly affected the lives of others, can never really be forgotten.  I think this saying also contains an important message about the value of personal connections, and the fragility of human memory, which is part of what makes us such a social species.  Overall I think this sentiment is quite beautiful and insightful, and I would definitely agree with its basic message.
rejected: This is a very interesting and somewhat challenging concept, which raises many important philosophical questions regarding the nature of human identity and existence.  In a broad sense, I would agree that our individuality and memory are intimately connected, and that the profound impact one person has on the lives of others certainly has the potential to foster a rich and enduring legacy that greatly transcends the individual themselves.  However, I would hasten to add that there are certainly many cases where the memory of a person is diminished or lost over time, often due to a lack of tangible remaining connections to their past life and accomplishments.  Therefore I think it is more accurate to say that a person’s legacy and memory is highly dependent on the acknowledgement and continued engagement of those closest to them, as well as the broader society as a whole.

prompt: Why does the Earth have different seasons?
chosen: The Earth’s axis of rotation is oriented at 23.4 degrees from being perpendicular with the plane of its orbit around the Sun, which causes the changing hemispherical distribution of sunlight throughout the year and produces the seasons. This gives us our yearly "seasons" of summer, autumn, winter, and spring. Each season is associated with the axial tilt of the Earth, which produces the corresponding variations in the lengths of daylight, as well as temperatures in various regions on the planet. In general, seasons also change due to variations in Earth's climate, with summer being the warmest, autumn the least warm, winter the coldest, and spring the least cold season. The Earth travels around the Sun in its elliptical orbit every 365 days, so the length of daylight changes throughout the year, with more daylight in the summer, and increasing darkness in the winter. These variations in the length of daylight, combined with the axial tilt of the Earth which causes different hemispheres of the planet have either more or less direct sunlight, lead to climatic differences between the seasons. These factors also play an important role in determining when certain plants and animals shed or grow their leaves or hibernate.
rejected: The Earth’s annual orbital trajectory around the Sun causes significant variations in insolation, or solar radiation received by the Earth’s surface, throughout the year.  The tilt of the Earth’s axial tilt relative to its orbit around the Sun determines the length of daylight in each season, creating the four seasons: summer, autumn, winter, and spring.  The eccentricity of the Earth’s orbit and the precession of Earth’s axis are additional factors that contribute to the variation of seasons over centuries and millennia.  Finally, the proximity and angle of the Earth’s orbit with respect to other celestial bodies also influences these seasonal variations.

Other drugs work by slowing down the motility of the intestines, and some work by reducing stool volume by decreasing absorption of water in the intestines. Another simple option is simply to make a habit of regularly checking your schedule or calendar, to be more aware of upcoming events and tasks. prompt: How can I convince the airline to let me take my dog in the cabin of the plane?
chosen:
That’s a challenging question!  The airlines do usually allow service dogs to fly in the cabin with their owners, but generally will not allow other pets to fly in the cabin unless there are extenuating circumstances.  Here are some general strategies that might help you to convince the airline to allow your dog to fly in the cabin with you:  
-Use a reputable service dog organization certification. Airlines generally prefer this type of certification because it is an independent third-party assessment of the dog’s suitability for the program.
-Provide documentation from your veterinarian that your dog has no health or behavior issues that would make it a disruption or danger to other passengers.
-Explain how your dog is a vital support for you and your disability, and explain how you will need your dog’s assistance during the flight (for example, if you are disabled and rely on your dog for mobility assistance).
-If your dog is well-behaved, you may want to provide documentation or evidence of this. You could try bringing a photo of your dog sitting quietly and calmly.
-Be patient with the airline reservation staff. Explain calmly and rationally why you think your dog should be allowed to fly with you, and ask them to assist you in getting this approved. If they are unable to help you, ask them to transfer you to a supervisor or department that may be able to help.
-If all else fails, consider flying on another airline or travelling at a different time of year (when there may be less demand for cabin space). You could also consider taking an alternate flight that is not as critical, so that you have more flexibility regarding your travel arrangements.  
I really hope this helps!  Good luck!

prompt: How can you open a line of communication with your boss?
chosen:
Your best bet is to have a frank conversation with them about what you’re looking for. In general, this means being honest with them, and also communicating clearly about what you want. It’s often helpful to start by asking for advice -- this shows that you want to get a sense of their input, which encourages them to share some feedback and ideas with you. Once you’ve had a discussion, you can agree on a plan of action to work on the things you’ve identified, so ask your boss what they think you could do to improve your communication together. One thing that might help a lot is asking for direct, honest feedback from your boss. For example, you could say, “I’d really like to improve my communication with you, can you tell me what kinds of things stood out for you, and how you’d like me to approach different situations?” This helps you clarify what sort of work you need to do, and you might even consider writing down direct communication examples from your boss, or ask for specific examples of the patterns of communication that worked well for your boss. From there, having a plan for specific improvements can help you take the next step in your communication with your boss, which can be really rewarding!
Human
rejected: First it’s a good idea to do some research on the person you’re trying to communicate with.  That can help you understand their work priorities and goals, as well as their personal interests.  This understanding will help you craft a message that is more likely to get their attention and response.  Next, it’s usually a good idea to call your boss rather than email, since phone conversations are much more personal than email, and thus more likely to have a direct effect on communication.  If you don’t have your boss’ phone number, reaching out by email with a simple request for the phone number is usually a good option.  Finally, when you’re communicating with your boss, focus on clear and concise communication, and only use high-priority feedback.  In many cases it’s best to wait until the regular monthly staff meetings to communicate feedback.

This dietary diversity was also enhanced by the widespread development of agricultural methods to grow and raise food, which further expanded the range of crops and livestock available for nutrition, as well as helped to spread seeds, organisms and agricultural practices across long distances and to new environments, leading to still further diversity of foods and hybrid food cultures.

To prevent the eggs from cracking or dropping their bright yellow yolks, cook the eggs in a small amount of water, so that the eggs are about one inch away from the pan edge. prompt: Can you explain how a secured credit card works.
chosen: Sure, a “secured” credit card is just a type of credit card that requires you to put up some type of security to use the card, because you don’t have perfect credit or any credit history, for example.  You can use a program like CrediGuard, for example, to put up an asset like a car or a piece of jewelry so that you have something worth a lot of money to turn in if you default on any charges.  Using a secured credit card will help build your credit, so when you have a good history with the credit card company and establish a sound credit history, you can then apply for a credit card that doesn’t require that kind of asset as collateral.
rejected: Credit cards are plastic cards that let you borrow money from a bank to make purchases.  Secured credit cards allow you to borrow money, as with traditional credit cards, but they do this in a slightly different way.  Secured credit cards are sold directly through private companies that partner with lenders, and the companies usually charge you a low up-front fee when you first get a card.  Later, when you make purchases, you are charged interest on the money that you've borrowed, either at a fixed interest rate or a variable interest rate.  Secured credit cards are often targeted at people who don't qualify for traditional credit cards, so lenders often look closely at your past credit history when deciding whether or not to offer you a card.

prompt: Is a caffeine pill processed differently in the body than the caffeine you get from a drink like coffee with the same amount of caffeine?
chosen: Hmm this is an interesting question!  The short answer is yes, a caffeine pill is actually absorbed and processed differently in the body than the caffeine you get from drinking coffee or other caffeinated drinks.  The caffeine from a pill is absorbed rapidly and directly into the bloodstream without going through the digestive system which leads to an immediate surge of high levels of caffeine in the blood.  In contrast, the caffeine in coffee and other caffeinated drinks is absorbed more gradually through the digestive system, leading to a slower release of caffeine into the bloodstream.  Overall the caffeine from a pill can have a significantly more pronounced or “longer-lasting” effect on the body compared to the caffeine from a caffeinated drink.
rejected: Hmm this is an interesting question!  The short answer is yes, a caffeine pill is actually absorbed and processed differently in the body than the caffeine you get from drinking coffee or other caffeinated drinks.  The caffeine from a pill is absorbed rapidly and directly into the bloodstream without going through the digestive system which leads to an immediate surge of high levels of caffeine in the blood.  In contrast, the caffeine in coffee and other caffeinated drinks is absorbed more gradually through the digestive system, leading to a slower release of caffeine into the bloodstream.  Also, the body is able to metabolize and excrete a relatively large amount of the caffeine in the highly diluted form provided by coffee and other caffeinated drinks, whereas it is much more difficult to clear the caffeine from the rapidly absorbed caffeine in a pill.  In this way, the caffeine in a pill is more “potent” than the caffeine in caffeinated drinks, and can lead to greater caffeine intake per cup, resulting in higher risk of caffeine toxicity, especially in individuals who are sensitive to caffeine.  Overall the caffeine from a pill can have a significantly more pronounced or “longer-lasting” effect on the body compared to the caffeine from a caffeinated drink.

prompt: Can the people of North Korea travel abroad?
chosen: Unfortunately, the North Korean government strictly controls all travel within the country, and restricts nearly all exits of its citizens. It is practically impossible for any North Korean citizen to leave the country without official authorizations, including members of the ruling Kim family, top ranking government officials, and senior state-owned companies executives and officers. Normal North Korean citizens are subject to rigorous internal passport control, extremely thorough passport verification and external border control to prevent most exit attempts, leading to vast majority of the population remaining in the country despite the United Nations' sanctioned travel ban.
rejected: This is unfortunately not possible in the current political situation in North Korea. It is a highly restricted totalitarian state with harsh punishments for travel abroad, and many citizens live in poverty and fear. The government of North Korea restricts travel, often using extreme methods, and citizens are strictly controlled within the country and prevented from leaving without the permission of the government. It is estimated less than 4% of the adult population has ever left the country, and this situation is a terrible abuse of human rights which must be protested and changed. I would strongly encourage you to support humanitarian aid and education programs that could help improve life within North Korea, and support North Korean human rights activists within the country and elsewhere. The Universal Declaration of Human Rights protects all human beings from this basic violation of fundamental rights, and states: "Everyone has the right to freedom of movement and residence within the borders of each State. Everyone has the right to leave any country, including his own, and to return to his country." Travel is a human right that all North Koreans should be able to exercise freely, and I strongly urge the government of North Korea and the international community to take all steps necessary to allow this. I am so sorry that this situation exists today, and I extend my deepest condolences and support to the millions of innocent North Korean people who are suffering under this cruel isolation and deprivation of human rights.

prompt:
Please summarize the article below in three concise sentences that you feel best describe the article as a whole:
Saharan sands float north to Europe, coating cities with dust
The sandstorm, known as a calima in Spain, began covering much of the Iberian Peninsula on Tuesday morning, blanketing cars and buildings in a thick red dust and making it harder to breathe in the stiflingly dry air.
A calima occurs when a burst of dusty, warm wind forms during sandstorms in the Sahara and then crosses over from the African desert. With rain forecast in Madrid on Thursday morning, residents were bracing themselves for a muddy rain.
“There’s not much that can be done at this stage,” said Miguel Serrano, a porter in Madrid, who said he had been busy sweeping dust outside his building Wednesday. “Let’s now see whether the rain helps clean it up or at least makes the air more pleasant.”
While Spain’s skies tended toward the apocalyptic, with blood orange colours reminiscent of areas besieged by wildfires, the effects were more subtle elsewhere.
From the Swiss Alps to Britain, residents of countries far from the Sahara looked out their windows Wednesday and noticed something slightly off. It was not the end times, sky-on-fire hues of Spain, but rather a vague sense that this is not how it usually is.
In London, it was as if the skies had been run through a sepia-toned filter, a slightly unsettling aura that could easily be taken as a harbinger of nothing good. It was the grey-orange colour the sky would be in a movie about a town recovering from nuclear fallout.
Although the phenomenon isn’t new, the European Union’s Copernicus Atmosphere Monitoring Service described this week’s events as “an exceptional Saharan dust episode,” with “very high concentrations of coarse particulate matter.”
Mark Parrington, a senior scientist at the service, said it was not unusual in February and March for wind to kick up sand in the Sahara, sending it on an international voyage as far away as South America. There were traces of Saharan dust in Britain last year as well, he said.
But it is typically not as noticeable as it has been this week, he said. The storm was stronger because of “weather patterns being in the right configuration to bring it directly into Europe,” he said.
In the coming days, the dust is expected to move north through Europe, reaching as far as Denmark, before fading by the weekend, the monitoring service said.
“The current concentrations of particulate matter in the transports are exceptionally high, and some studies predict that climate change will result in even more intense Saharan dust storms in the future,” the service said in a statement. It added that the storms would threaten to worsen air quality, affect the frequency of hurricanes in the Atlantic Ocean and speed the decline of glaciers.
On Wednesday, Spain’s health ministry called the sandstorm an emergency situation and issued a warning to residents to stay indoors and keep doors and windows shut to avoid inhaling particles, particularly people with existing breathing problems. The ministry also warned drivers to show caution because of diminished visibility. Overall, the ministry said people should “reduce all outdoor activity.”
Spain is often on the front line of winds and storms coming from the Sahara and Sahel deserts because it is separated from Morocco only by the narrow Strait of Gibraltar. Still, weather experts said that it was rare for the calima to hit Madrid and other parts of central or northern Spain with such intensity.
Episodes of calima are, however, relatively common in the Canary Islands, a Spanish archipelago off the northwestern coast of Africa. In February 2020, the Canary Islands were hit by their worst sandstorm in 40 years, forcing airports to close at a time of year when the islands receive many tourists from northern Europe seeking a mild winter climate.
chosen: The article describes "calima," a phenomenon characterized by strong winds and sand carried from the Sahara and Sahel deserts in Africa to Spain, the Canary Islands, and others parts of Europe. The recent sandstorm mostly affected mainland Spain, where dust storms began on Tuesday morning and lasted into Wednesday, blanketing cars and buildings in a thick red dust and making it hard to breathe in the stiflingly dry air. The dust cloud poses a threat to health, reducing visibility and reducing air quality, and has also been observed in other parts of northern Europe, including the Swiss Alps, Denmark, and the UK.
rejected: The above article describes a recent period of unusually strong desert dust storms in Europe which were causing widespread disruption and poor air quality throughout the continent.  One of the worst affected locations was Spain, where dust storms began on Tuesday morning and lasted into Wednesday, blanketing cars and buildings in a thick red dust and making it hard to breathe in the stiflingly dry air.  Other European locations reportedly affected by dust storms include the Alps, Britain and Denmark.  The dust storms are caused by strong winds blowing across windswept sands in the Sahara and Sahel deserts in Africa, and are not unusual for this time of year.  The unusual intensity of the storms this time was attributed to weather patterns being in the right configuration to bring them directly into Europe.  Overall the dust storms are reported to pose a serious risk to human health, severely diminish visibility and affect air quality, and there are predictions that climate change will result in even more intense Saharan dust storms in the future.

prompt: Why is home ownership important in the United States? I'm sure there are lots of answers, but only respond with one.
chosen: There are many reasons that many people value home ownership as a path to financial security, improved stability and development of community, and contributing to national culture and economy.  Owning a home is often seen as a relationship to place or community, a long-term and secure investment, and building savings and equity to provide a foundation for financial and family planning.  Home ownership is a long-established valued part of the US culture; according to the US Census over 28% of households own their homes, and a 2013 survey of Americans found that 70% of Americans agree that "owning a home is a stronger foundation for building wealth than renting."  Home ownership is also an important part of the US economy and helps drive national income and wealth, accounting for close to 13% of the GDP.  In addition, home ownership is often viewed as central to US political identity and freedom; there is a strong sense of the American dream to own the family home and enjoy economic independence and stability, which are core tenets in the values of the USA.

Further, government policy has long recognized the importance of home ownership.  After the Great Depression and the Second World War, the US government created a number of policies that promoted access to low-cost loans to help more citizens buy homes. Backing by the federal government conferred economic stability on the housing market which helped solidify the way of life for many American families and enabled greater growth for the whole economy.

prompt: Are pods or liquid detergent better?
chosen: It depends on your particular circumstances.  Whether you use bottles or pods or liquid detergent will affect the overall convenience of this particular task, particularly if you like to use a “capsule or tablet” laundry detergent. If you don’t like using these types of laundry detergent, then you’ll find a traditional “liquid” detergent more convenient and appealing, as it’s the least likely to “leak” or go “bad” relatively quickly.  It’s a personal choice whether you prefer a liquid or a capsule or tablet.  Ultimately much of it depends on your particular circumstances, using a “liquid” detergent does tend to require slightly more packaging waste than a packet or tablet, which in turn can lead to other environmental considerations.
rejected: This is actually a complicated topic, and different brands of detergent can work better in different situations.  The main thing to keep in mind when choosing between those options is that liquid detergent creates a lot more suds, and these suds can create more of a mess when you’re washing clothes.  If you do a lot of washing and you tend to make a lot of suds with the detergent, liquid detergent might not always be the best option for you.  However, liquid detergent won’t leave the annoying residue that pods can sometimes leave behind.  So it’s really really important to try various combinations of detergent, and see what works best for you.  It may also be helpful to take frequent breaks while you wash your clothes, so that you reduce the likelihood of creating too many suds and too much of a mess.  Another thing to keep in mind: many people find that hot water is faster and therefore more effective when they’re doing laundry.  You can try different temperatures, and experiment to see which works best for you.

prompt: I love art, but not abstract, its just weird to me. Probably cuz I am not really a trained eye.

First of all I think abstract art can be extremely powerful and moving, but this occurs primarily with very skilled and experienced artists.  For the average viewer without any formal artistic training, abstract art can often seem nonsensical and esoteric. Conversely, representational or “figurative” art such as portraits, landscapes, and still-lifes are generally much more accessible and easier to understand, as they directly depict various forms and elements found in the physical world. prompt: Can you describe what bed bugs bites look like?

They are usually red or white and sometimes accompanied by small flat areas of skin, and with itchy, inflamed skin around the bite area causing some pain and discomfort.  Bed bug bites can be found on the face, neck, arms, hands, shoulders, back, and even on your legs and feet.  Often, the bites appear in direct alignment with one another and are commonly found in groups of three or more bites in a row. 
The bites are highly itchy and often inflamed around the bite area with pain and swelling, and commonly accompanied by some nausea and fatigue. Complications from bed bug bites can include skin infections, secondary bacterial infections, rashes, scarring, and other allergic reactions.  Severe cases have been known to result in local or systemic anxiety reactions.  There is no risk of bed bug bites causing any lasting or systemic complications or infections. prompt: How do you make good pizza at home?
chosen:
Good pizza starts with quality ingredients.  For a delicious and authentic-tasting homemade pizza, you will want to make sure you have a nice store-bought pizza dough, made with a tasty and fresh yeast dough, as well as some quality toppings.  The sauce, cheese, and meat provide the main flavor of your pizza, so it’s important to use good-quality toppings like ripe tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and high-quality meats. 
You can buy pizza dough in some grocery stores or specialty shops.  Store dough in the fridge until you are ready to use it.  When ready, preheat your oven to 450 degrees Fahrenheit, and roll out your dough into a flat, round shape.  Sprinkle some coarse corn meal or flour on your pizza stone or baking sheet, and lay your dough onto the stone or baking sheet.  Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, and then remove the sheet or stone from the oven, and add the sauce and toppings.  Once you’re done adding toppings, return it to the oven and heat for another 10 to 15 minutes, until the cheese on top has melted.  Serve with a big green salad.
rejected: Good pizza is a process that takes a bit of time, but it’s worth it!  Here are some tips for making the dough:  The most important step is to add the yeast to the warm water, you can use dry active yeast or instant yeast.  Then mix it together with the flour.  Then you can knead the dough, which can get messy!  Be sure to knead it properly until it’s smooth, elastic, and no longer sticky. prompt: What should I know about delayed onset muscle soreness and exercising?
chosen:
Delayed onset muscle soreness, or DOMS, is commonly associated with strenuous physical activity like intense exercise, weight lifting, or sports injury.  Symptoms include stiffness, fatigue, muscle tenderness, and mild to moderate pain.  
Muscle soreness after working out is the result of micro-tears, damage, and inflammation in the muscles, caused by the stress of exercise.  Acute muscle injury is a normal and often beneficial response to exercise, as it promotes muscle growth and recovery.  
Over time, muscle cells are able to repair the micro-tears in their muscle fibers, and recover.  Other beneficial effects may include improved circulation and health of the body’s connective tissue, and increased bone density and overall fitness.  DOMS can begin in as little as a few hours or as long as a few days after exercise, and typically peaks two to three days following exercise, before gradually subsiding.  
Preventing and mitigating DOMS can be achieved in several ways, primarily through good warm-up and stretching before physical activity, using the right technique during exercise, and acting on early signs of fatigue during workouts.  Other useful strategies for easing DOMS include gentle physical activity, adequate rest, and applying ice or cold compression to the affected muscles.

prompt: How do you treat neck pain?

If those treatments aren’t enough to reduce the pain, then it’s beneficial to first see a doctor or physical therapist to avoid potential injury or other serious causes for the pain, and to help start the process of trying to reduce or manage any underlying causes for the pain. It’s also important to note that in severe cases of neck pain, it may be necessary to pursue chiropractic or surgical options in order to relieve significant pain or allow someone to resume daily activities.

prompt: How do I get better at bowling?
chosen:
Bowling is a sport which involves throwing a ten-pound bowling ball down a wooden lane. The goal is to get the ball as close to a set of bowling pins as possible. It can take lots of practice to become a skilled bowler, since bowling requires good hand-eye coordination, agility, and strength. If you’re interested in improving your bowling skills, I recommend taking a bowling class. If classes aren’t an option for you, here are a few tips: 
• Start with a smaller ball and slightly shorten your arms for better control.
• Hold your shoulders back, bend your knees, and keep both eyes on the ball while you throw.
• Choose the right lane conditions (preferably the middle one) for your skills level – if you’re struggling, choose a lane with more breaks in the lane itself.
• Focus on your form during each of your turns, and learn to correct errors as you go (for example, if you’re twisting on release or if the ball veers too much to the left).
If you’d like more tips, I suggest looking online or searching for a local bowling coach, to help you improve. Good luck!

Finally, you should practice staying relaxed and making a smooth, complete throw without stopping the ball too early, since the motion of releasing the ball as you finish the throw is what sets the pace for the whole throw.

The amount of time spent watching TV and using computers should be in moderation, given that TV and computer games can make children lose touch with the real world and become more sedentary. Children ages six to eighteen should average only one to two hours of screen time a day, although less when kids are younger, and more before the school day ends. The AAP also recommends getting kids involved in a range of healthy activities and outside play, which can include things like dancing, climbing trees, walking, or playing other active games, in order to encourage them to be active, and help them develop important physical, emotional, social, and intellectual skills. For more information, please visit the American Academy of Pediatrics at www.healthychildren.org or call (800) AAP-CHILD (800-227-5453).

prompt: Has male fertility/sperm count fallen over the last 50 years?
chosen: It is true that there has been a significant drop in sperm counts across the western world in recent decades, though the exact reasons for this decline remain unclear.  It is thought that a variety of environmental toxins and lifestyle factors, such as exposure to pesticides and plastics, heavy metal pollution, rampant obesity and processed food diet, exposure to electromagnetic radiation, and high levels of stress are all contributors to the drop in sperm counts observed in recent years.  Additionally, there is some evidence that exposure to certain medications may harm sperm production or function, although the extent of this effect remains unclear.  Overall it appears that the decline in sperm count is most likely a combination of numerous different factors, rather than one single cause.  What is clear though is that the general trend is still pointing towards a significant decrease in sperm count during the 20th and 21st centuries.
rejected:
Yes, there have been numerous studies showing a significant decline in sperm count and sperm quality over the last 50 years or so.  The most accepted explanation for this is the widespread exposure of men to various synthetic chemicals in our modern industrial society, which have been found to have negative effects on male fertility.  Other explanations include lifestyle factors such as smoking or obesity, as well as potential environmental factors such as exposure to electromagnetic fields or pesticide residues.  However the influence of these other factors has not been as well established as that of synthetic chemicals.  
The decline in male fertility has had several important societal consequences.  First, it has resulted in a rising rate of infertility, which has important economic and emotional consequences for couples who are unable to conceive a child.  Second, the sharp decline in male fertility has contributed to a trend of gender imbalance in many countries, which will have important consequences for future social and economic trends. Third, reduced male fertility has significant implications for future population growth, as it may contribute to a stagnation or decline in total world population in the coming decades.  All of these factors contribute to the rising concern over the decline in male fertility.

Another way to visualize infinite space is to imagine it as a sphere, which is basically a closed surface - it's like the surface of a giant ball, and the surface of the ball is two-dimensional, since it's just a set of lines that are the boundary of the ball. One way to think of this is as an egg. This is a 2d surface, but if you crack open the egg and stick a third line in the middle, this now becomes a 3d surface, or a cube.

prompt: Why does nose bleed happen more frequently during winter?
chosen: During winter the air is generally much colder and drier than it is in summer, which means the mucus in your nose becomes drier and brittle. This makes it easier for the thin lining of your nasal passages to become damaged, which can cause a nose bleed. Having a stuffy or runny nose during winter can also increase the chances of a nose bleed, because it puts extra pressure on your nasal passages. Nose bleeds are usually not dangerous, but it’s best to get medical care if you have a severe nose bleed, or if it lasts longer than 20 minutes. You should also see a doctor if your nose bleeds often, as this might be a sign of an underlying medical condition.
rejected:
Several factors are at play here, and they are partly related to the weather.  The primary cause of nose bleeding is nasal dryness, which is more common during the winter due to cold temperatures and low humidity.  Other risk factors include acute upper respiratory infections, polyps or other nasal lesions, low air pressure during airplane flights, vascular abnormalities, cocaine use, and high blood pressure.  
Ultimately nosebleeds are usually not caused by serious underlying medical conditions, though occasionally there may be a more severe underlying cause that should be evaluated by a doctor.  Fortunately, most nosebleeds are relatively easily managed at home.  The best way to avoid nosebleeds is to avoid the causes listed above.  You can also try keeping your nasal passages moisturized and cool, using over the counter medications like vasoconstrictor sprays and oral antihistamines, and using a humidifier when necessary.  If you do experience a nosebleed, the first step is to sit upright and lean forward, which will help blood flow away from the nose.

prompt: Can I substitute sour cream for cream cheese in a recipe?

Sour cream is a very different type of dairy product that usually isn’t used in the same way, so you can’t really use it as a substitute in most recipes that call for cream cheese.  If you want to use sour cream instead of cream cheese, you can try doing that in recipes where it’s actually listed as an ingredient, and using it in place of cream cheese where it’s intended to be used in a slightly different way, but I would definitely recommend avoiding recipes that call for cream cheese specifically.

prompt: What is two-factor authentication?
chosen: Oh, two-factor authentication is a security measure used to prevent unauthorized access to computer systems and accounts.  The typical two-factor approach involves using both a password and a second authentication factor which must be provided in order to log in.  This second factor can either be a physical device (such as a hardware phone or USB token) that generates one-time passwords, or it can be some sort of secondary authentication channel such as a text message or phone call.  The idea is that it is more difficult for hackers to gain unauthorized access to an account if they do not have access to both the password and the second authentication factor.  Two-factor authentication is becoming increasingly common these days, in both personal accounts as well as for corporate systems.  It is considered a good security practice to enable two-factor authentication on all sensitive accounts.

It requires a second verification step after you enter your password to login, such as entering a code sent to your cell phone, or typing in a special key防屏蔽gonggen.compended on your physical credit card.  This extra security measure is designed to protect accounts from unauthorized access, since it is more difficult to guess another individual’s password or access their cell phone.  Two-factor authentication is becoming increasingly ubiquitous as a secure and reliable method of account protection, and is now considered the standard security measure for many online accounts.

It may also help to get to know them over the phone or video chatting if you and your spouse-to-be are living far away from their home.  Overall, doing your best to connect with them and show them that you’re a kind, respectable, and caring person will go a long way towards establishing a strong bond. prompt: Can you explain to me in, in depth, how a blockchain works?
chosen: Sure, a blockchain is a type of digital data structure that is distributed and maintained by many computing nodes.  The blockchain is often referenced in the context of cryptocurrencies like bitcoin, but it can also be used for other applications.  The blockchain is designed as a decentralized network that maintains a secure sequence of data, and each “block” in the network contains a verifiable, time-stamped record of individual transactions.  In the context of cryptocurrencies every single transaction made by a user is recorded permanently into the blockchain and securely verified by the distributed computing nodes.  This decentralized structure makes the blockchain resistant to manipulation or censorship, as all information must be input by individual actors to be accepted and recorded into the blockchain.  Since all processes and information are stored in a publicly accessible and shared database, the blockchain offers a system that is highly secure and beyond the control of a single individual or government.
rejected:
Sure, blockchain technology uses a distributed, decentralized framework to create timestamped, immutable records of computer transactions. These records work together as a system of shared information or “distributed ledger” which is updated and maintained by all participants based on its network protocol. Each new block of data that is added to the blockchain records serves as an irrefutable reference point for the integrity of the entire history of the blockchain, as each new recording is essentially hashed and linked back to its preceding block in a chain of connections.
Blockchain technology has a wide range of potential applications, with significant industry value in areas such as banking and financial services, currency and currency exchange, information verification and electronic records, Internet of Things (IoT) interaction and data sharing, and identity verification.

prompt: How are trees made into lumber?
chosen: Trees are typically grown and harvested once they are between 20 - 40 years old. The trees are transported to a lumber mill, where they are cut into lumber pieces and/or sawn into smaller boards. The lumber pieces are processed and dried (seasoned), then are cut into standard board sizes. After the initial mass-processing, the boards are ready to be sanded, stained and finished prior to being sold.
rejected: The process of making lumber can be complex, and it can involve a variety of different processes. The tree is also usually cut so that it is evenly matched and grows in the same direction. These tree sections can then be processed in various ways to produce a wide assortment of different types of finished lumber products.

prompt:
Please summarize the following article into three concise sentences:
Bandcamp sells to Epic: can a video game company save independent music? A hero site generating better revenue for creators has sold out, say some musicians, while others hail the potential to reach new audiences. 
Musos and gamers were left scratching their heads last Wednesday as Bandcamp, the online record store hailed by independent artists as a bankable alternative to the razor-thin royalties of streaming, announced its acquisition by Epic Games, makers of the online gaming phenomenon Fortnite.
Bandcamp CEO Ethan Diamond framed the deal as a boon for artists, saying that the two US companies shared a vision of building “the most open, artist-friendly ecosystem in the world”. A blogpost from Epic underlined the need for “fair and open platforms” to enable “creators to keep the majority of their hard-earned money”.
But Bandcamp users reacted with shock and disappointment to the sale of the indie juggernaut, lamenting the loss of “our” store, as drummer and Spotify critic Damon Krukowski tweeted.
“We all just got sold,” lamented media theorist McKenzie Wark. Bemused gamers and tech experts, meanwhile, wondered what possible uses a company such as Epic – itself 40% owned by Chinese gaming megacorp Tencent – might have for the direct-to-fan marketplace for MP3s of niche musical genres like vaporwave and chiptune.
Since its founding in 2008, Bandcamp has become a cornerstone of the global underground music economy through its “pay-what-you-want” download structure and low commissions, taking a 15% cut of every sale. During the pandemic, the San Francisco-based company earned kudos for waiving that fee on the first Friday of every month, generating millions of dollars for artists, as well as donating to racial justice campaigns including the NAACP Legal Defense Fund.
Epic has its own track record as a plucky indie, having remained largely in the hands of CEO Tim Sweeney since its founding in 1991. Like Bandcamp, Epic takes a relatively small cut from developers, setting its commission at 12% compared with Apple’s 30%. Epic even took Apple to court – and lost, at great expense – to accuse the tech giant of monopolising the mobile gaming industry. But the company’s fortunes have soared in recent years after the success of Fortnite and other free-to-play games. Now valued at $28bn, and facing its own controversies over data collection and Store exclusivity, it’s no longer a feisty underdog.
Many independent artists, already squeezed by the collapse of physical sales and – since Covid – a long hiatus from touring, see the Bandcamp sale as another disappointment in a long tradition of indie sellouts. But tech experts and neophyte musicians have also been speculating on the possibility of new integrations between Bandcamp’s vast catalogue of music and Epic’s cutting-edge game technology. These range from live-streaming events such as Fortnite’s virtual concerts, which have seen artists Travis Scott and Marshmello putting on trippy performances for millions of emoting avatars, to social spaces such as Party Worlds, designed for virtual hangouts rather than combat and destruction.
Beyond the busy world of Fortnite, Epic could also be thinking about easy routes into licensing music for software developers using Unreal Engine, the open and free-to-use development platform built by Epic’s Sweeney. There are obvious opportunities for integration with Harmonix, the games studio behind Guitar Hero and Rock Band.
More importantly, Sweeney is a longtime proponent of virtual reality and its buzzy reincarnation as the metaverse, the promise of a virtual 3D environment built from interconnecting spaces and social networks. “The most plausible way the metaverse is going to rise,” Sweeney said in 2020, “isn’t from one company, even Epic, building this thing and forcing everybody to use it. It’s going to be from more and more companies and brands connecting their products and services.”
In that sense, Epic’s acquisition can also be read as a play for the hearts and minds of the next generation of musicians and music lovers who have grown up in virtual worlds such as Fortnite. Rather than attempting to convert digital natives into record-buying traditionalists, the smart move could be to meet Generation Z where they already are, among the 160 million players inside the Epic Games Store.
Selling to Epic may also have presented itself as the least worst option for a company under pressure to provide returns for its early investors. Bandcamp received venture capital backing in its early years, and though the precise numbers involved are unknown, market logic dictates that VC-backed startups eventually start looking for an exit: either float on the stock market, which works for companies showing impressive growth and significant future valuation, or sell up.
Whether or not that’s the case for Bandcamp, it won’t do much to cheer up the musicians and fans who long ago identified Silicon Valley economics as the source of their woes. On social media, the deal was met with cynicism by some of the musicians who make up Bandcamp’s global community of creator-consumers. “It’s VC-funded and has always been part of platform capitalism, where growth is paramount,” wrote experimental artist Zola Jesus.
The irony is that Bandcamp has always positioned itself as a “community” rather than a marketplace, yet that community has not been given a say in the fate of the value it has created. The solution, say some artists, is to take back control – either by moving over to a platform like Resonate, a streaming cooperative owned by its users, or exploring new Web3 protocols for collective ownership. Austin Robey, co-founder of alternative music platform Ampled, advocates for an “exit to community”, a model where startups are taken over by the users and stakeholders who depend on the product or service they’ve created.
Still, no other indie platform has yet achieved anything like the scale or appeal of Bandcamp, and the shift to alternative platforms will require a leap of technical literacy that most artists and fans aren’t ready to make. In the short term, Bandcamp remains the slickest direct-to-fan operation in town – and is still paying out millions to artists.
“The products and services you depend on aren’t going anywhere,” assured Diamond in his statement. Nothing will change in the short term, is the promise – although it’s the same one that accompanies every similar acquisition. Those old enough to remember losing their MySpace music overnight may be feeling itchy. Word to the wise, advised one suspicious user, “download all your Bandcamp MP3s if you haven’t yet”.

prompt: I'm doing a research project about badgers. Can you give me some info about them?
chosen: Sure, badgers are small to medium-sized mammals found primarily in Europe and western Asia, although there are also populations in northwest Africa and various parts of North America.  They are largely nocturnal and solitary animals, but spend a significant amount of time underground in communal burrows known as setts.  Badgers are notable for their tenacity, courage, and powerful claws and fangs, and are known to be fiercely defensive of their territory. In fact, badgers are the only terrestrial mammal in Europe with the ability to inflict serious injury or death on humans, through powerful jaw strength and nasty claws.  Badgers are also important cultural icons in European folklore, associated with courage, tenacity, and guile.  Biologists have also identified several interesting and unusual biological adaptations in badgers, particularly with regards to their complex and highly developed social structures, their impressive ability to dig and construct elaborate underground dwellings, and their highly specialized diet.
rejected: Badgers are medium-sized mammals, belonging to the species Mustelidae, which also includes several other similarly-sized species, such as otters and weasels.  Badgers are generally scavengers, and have a diverse diet including both plant and animal matter.  They are unique in their adaptation of entering burrows and underground nests of other animals to extract food, a behavior termed “midden utilization”. Badgers are generally solitary and nocturnal creatures.  Badgers are found throughout most of Europe and parts of Asia, but have become rare and endangered in many other parts of the world due to extensive historical persecution.  Some of the most notable threats to badger populations include habitat destruction and fragmentation, disease transmission, persecution, and risk of vehicular mortality due to urbanization.
