prompt: What is the difference between 110v and 220v in the home?
chosen: The standard electrical current in most of North America is 110 volts, though some places may use a range of voltages, from 110 to 120 to 240.  The number refers to the voltage, or the force that makes current flow.  The difference between 110v and 220v is that the current has twice the voltage, and twice the force.  This means it can put twice as much power into appliances, or that the appliance needs to be more durable in order to work at 220v.  If you plug in an appliance at 220v that was designed for 110v, it could be more dangerous, and may damage or break the appliance.
rejected: Your home was probably wired to use both 110v and 220v.  Your home was most likely wired with two separate sets of wires to allow you to use either voltage.  You can use whichever one is more convenient for the appliance you are using at the time.  You would likely use 110v for lamps, for example, while using 220v for fans and things that require more power.

prompt: Can you tell me what type of design elements are used in skyscraper construction?
chosen: Sure!  Skyscrapers use both structural and non-structural design elements.  Structural elements are those that make the building structurally stable and capable of holding up loads - beams, floors, columns, and so on.  Non-structural design elements are for the aesthetics and comfort of the occupants.  They can be the building layout, floor layout, the structural frame, and some elements of the interior such as the stairs, lights, and windows.
rejected: There are several common elements that are used to build skyscrapers.  Brick, concrete, steel, and glass are the most commonly used materials for skyscraper walls, floors, and roofs.  Some skyscrapers also use ceramic tiles and other decorative materials, and modern skyscrapers can be built using materials such as aluminum, concrete, and glass.  Skyscrapers are also designed to use structural elements such as steel beams and large foundations to provide stability, and architects often use high-tech systems like elevators and air conditioning to make skyscrapers easier to live and work in.

prompt: How do you drill ceramic tile?
chosen: Here’s an explanation. First, you mark the position of each hole with tape.  Then, you need a drilling machine. The drill bit should be set to a drill diameter smaller than the diameter of the wall tile you’re installing.  If it’s too large, the hole will go through, which will cause a problem with the wall-to-wall connection.  The hole should be big enough to allow for the thickness of the tile.  Typically, this is done by placing a piece of adhesive tape with a specific thickness under the drilling bit. Then, move the drilling machine back and forth while keeping your eye on the wall. Once it’s done, you can press the tile in and align it.
rejected: Ooh, fun question! You know, there are different approaches to drilling holes in tile, depending on the situation.  One of the most common approaches is to use a special kind of drill bit that cuts through the tile, as opposed to simply shattering it or pushing it around.  Such a bit can be expensive, and they wear down over time, so you have to be careful about drilling too many holes.

prompt: How do I use a pressure washer to clean surfaces?

There are basically two common ways of using the pressure washer.  First, for small-scale cleaning of large areas (like parking lots), people often like to use a pressure washer wand to spray a solution on the surface and then use a “wand scrubber” or “broom” with a plastic blade to scrub off the solution and dirt.  This works well for surfaces that can take the pressure, such as driveways and sidewalks, but is harder for surfaces that are too soft, like grass.  Alternatively, some people use the pressure washer on the side of a structure, like a wall or a house.  For this, the operator must hold the wand in place to direct the spray where it is needed, and also often brings a brush along to scrub off the dirt.

prompt: How do you make a cell phone battery last longer?
chosen:
It’s really important to avoid battery-draining habits.  A little thing is if you’re about to leave your phone behind, perhaps on a trip or at home while you’re away, you can always just turn it off to save battery, and then turn it back on when you’re ready to use it.  This is easy to do, and in particular, I love that feature in the iPhone.  
Another is to use power-saving modes on your phone.  This can actually also save a surprising amount of power.  For instance, my old Android phone had a mode in which it would turn off the screen as soon as you stopped touching it, which really shaved off the power it would use over an hour.  This is a really easy and effective thing to do, and probably other phones do similar things.  (In some phone OSs, you can adjust settings to turn the screen off after a certain period of inactivity, and this can save a lot of power.  Most phone OSs have an option to automatically turn off Wi-Fi, and that’s another simple way to save power.  Note that you may have to turn it on again manually from time to time though, depending on the
rejected: There are many factors that influence how long a battery lasts. Let’s talk about a few of them.  First, a phone that has a fancy screen is more expensive, but it usually has more features and uses more power.  Second, how often you use your phone has a big effect.  Using it very sparingly, say once a day, will let it last much longer than checking it every couple of minutes.  Third, if you’re using WiFi or other wireless networking technologies, this probably means you’re closer to other people, which is a positive thing, but it also drains your phone’s battery.  You can improve the battery’s capacity to store electricity by not using certain features and power-draining technologies.

prompt: Why do airlines make you put your phones on "airplane" mode when flying?
chosen: There are two big reasons airlines want you to turn off your phones while flying.  First, the airplanes might fly over an area where radio transmissions might interfere with control signals to the airplane.  Second, they want to protect the privacy of everyone in the cabin.  So, it's a safety thing, and it's also a privacy thing.

So by default they set this policy, that’s fine.  
However, if you do want to use your phone during your flight, then you can set your phone to "flight mode".  There is an airplane mode setting that is different from the flight mode setting, and they have the same name but they're different -- one doesn’t prevent your phone from receiving calls or texts, and the other does.

prompt: how do i make sourdough bread?
chosen:
Alright! I’m going to share with you my favorite sourdough recipe, although it’s also available online:
-Put together your ingredients and a large bowl of warm water. 
-Warm a bowl of water in the oven on 150 degrees for about 5-10 minutes.
-Get a spoon and your ingredients. 
-Add 1.5 tablespoons yeast and mix.
-Put 1 cup of warm water in the mixture and stir it. 
-Keep stirring with the spoon until it’s an even consistency and bubbling. 
-Add flour 1 cup at a time. 
-Keep stirring until you have a wet dough. 
-Add 1 cup more flour and mix until you get a strong dough ball, then cover the bowl and let the dough rest for 10 minutes.
-Start kneading by pressing the dough from the outside in, and folding it to the inside. Repeat this process until the dough becomes soft and elastic.
-Allow the dough to rest for another 10 minutes.

Knead the dough until smooth, form it into a ball, and let it rise a second time until it doubles in size. Punch the dough down, divide it in half, and form each half into a loaf. Place the loaves into the prepared container and let rise again until the dough has doubled in size. Bake the loaves in a preheated oven until they’re golden brown. Remove from the oven and let cool before serving.

The common cold is caused by a virus, and the general principle is to “not feed the virus” by getting rest and staying hydrated, and to give the body’s immune system a chance to fight it.  Some other recommendations include drinking plenty of fluids, breathing steam, using cough drops with honey, taking vitamin C, and maybe some fever-reducing medications.
rejected: There are many potential treatments for the common cold, but it’s hard to say which is best without more context.  The general recommendations are to just drink plenty of water and get a good amount of sleep.  You might also want to take a daily vitamin supplement, to help keep you healthy and make you feel good.  Beyond that, it’s really a question of how fast you want to get over the cold and back to a healthy state, and how you feel about the particular medicines or other treatments.  What do you think?

prompt: What are some suggestions to help quit smoking?
chosen:
Some strategies for quitting smoking include:
-   avoiding situations that tend to make you smoke, like bars and parties
-   spending more time with non-smoking friends
-   replacing cigarettes with healthier habits, like exercise and eating a healthy diet
-   setting a date to quit smoking and sticking to it
-   using strategies like relaxation techniques or distraction to help you resist the urge to smoke
rejected:
Smoking cessation is challenging, and quitting is hard.  Nicotine is both highly addictive and also an especially difficult thing to give up, which makes this process extra-difficult.  But the hardest part is typically not the addiction -- it’s the negative reinforcement.  This is how, in the short-term, quitting smoking can be hard:

-Many people develop an addiction to smoking, and if they do try to quit they experience unpleasant physical withdrawal symptoms
-For people who are used to smoking regularly, they may be doing this during many of their social interactions
-If people are used to smoking regularly, they may experience unpleasant withdrawal symptoms at times where they would usually smoke, for example after meals, when they are drinking, when they are stressed or bored
-Nicotine is addictive, so the brain associates quitting smoking with unpleasant withdrawal symptoms, and thus feels like quitting

prompt: How do I potty train a puppy?

Potty training a puppy requires some discipline and consistency on the part of the owner.  Ideally, puppies should only relieve themselves in their own yard, or at least, only in a place where the ground is heavily covered with grass or dirt. It can help if you use puppy pads or clippings from grass to make the area pleasant to sit on.
The first step is to get the puppy used to relieving itself somewhere near the owner, and in a specified area.  Then, the owner needs to stay by the puppy’s side at all times, to reward it with praise and treat it when it does its business in the right area.

prompt: What were the main factors that led to the Renaissance
chosen: The Renaissance (also known as the “Early Modern Period”) was a cultural shift in Europe that began in the 14th century and lasted into the 17th century.  It was the beginning of the Early Modern Period, and was characterized by a renewed interest in humanism, the arts, exploration, and rational thought.  This shift occurred in spite of the Black Death, and the beginning of the Hundred Years War.  I would say that one main driver of the Renaissance was an increased interest in humanism, and the arts, and in the sciences.  Additionally, there were a number of political and social changes in the late 14th and 15th centuries that contributed to this cultural shift.  These include the expansion of the Medici family, the rise of the new Ottoman Empire, and the decreased influence of the Church.  I would say that the combination of these factors helped contribute to the Renaissance.
rejected: There were two key factors. First, there was the invention of the printing press in the 1400s. This allowed ideas to spread much more widely, and also allowed more people to access information. And in the 1500s, the explorer/colonists of the New World started coming back with lots of information about the cultures they found, which challenged many of the established paradigms at the time. These two factors coincided and helped fuel each other.

prompt: Did the United States have to get involved in the Vietnam War or was it a political decision?
chosen: The Vietnam War was a confluence of a number of different factors, with the ultimate root being the cold war.  The main goal of the US in Vietnam was to prevent communism from taking over South East Asia and gaining access to the crucial sea-lanes around Indonesia and the Philippines.  As such, the US had to take steps to prevent a revolution in Vietnam, and the removal of the ruling French was a key step.  Vietnam itself is a fascinatingly diverse country, with one third of its population comprised of ethnic Chinese people, yet another third are of mixed Vietnamese and French descent, and the final third are Khmer people, whose cultural and religious heritage is closer to that of Cambodia.  In addition, there are strong ethnic Vietnamese groups in the surrounding area.  These various populations have been competing with one another for years, with the Khmer minority historically dominating the Vietnamese and the Chinese minorities, who in turn have dominated the French.  This makes Vietnam especially complex, with history having left it in a state of multi-layered political tension.  In this context, the US entered the picture, and the key decision it faced was how to intervene, rather than “staying out”.
rejected: While it was technically a decision of the Johnson Administration, many people believe that the United States was essentially forced into a military conflict in Vietnam.  In August of 1964, North Vietnam began a full scale invasion of the southern half of Vietnam.  The United States supported South Vietnam by sending military advisors, and by bombing the North Vietnamese coast.  But these actions proved to be unsuccessful, and led to more provocative actions by the North Vietnamese.  This led to a more aggressive approach by the United States in the form of multiple bombing campaigns, and the introduction of the first American ground troops into the Vietnam conflict, which would lead to a direct confrontation between the North and the South in South Vietnam.

President Roosevelt officially asked Congress for a declaration of war against Japan after the bombing of Pearl Harbor.

prompt: How can I protect myself during an earthquake?
chosen:
I would recommend taking a variety of steps to reduce your personal risk from an earthquake.  Here are some general steps to take:
*If you feel an earthquake starting, get in a doorway or against an interior wall. 
*If you are indoors, stay there and hold on until the shaking stops. 
*If you’re outside, get inside somewhere safe immediately. 
*After the shaking stops, be aware that there may be secondary hazards. For example, a damaged gas line could explode, or electrical lines may fall. Listen to your local media or emergency alerts for more information about this.

You should try to evacuate if you have the time and if you have the chance, but if you feel the shaking start to get very strong, drop, cover and hold on! prompt: How do radio scanners work?
chosen:
Well, these days they’re very sophisticated, but at a basic level they’re just a lot of parts working together.  
First, you need a wide band antenna, which broadcasts and receives a range of frequencies.  
Next, you need a radio tuner, which can tune in to one specific frequency.  
In addition, you need some electronics that can amplify the signal (but not in a way that distorts it).  
Finally, you need some way to display and hear the signal, like a speaker and a headphone, or an FM radio, or a line-in cable for your computer.
rejected: An air scanner or “radio scanner” is a device for listening to radio signals.  It receives sounds from the air around it and produces an audible or visible representation of that sound.  The typical use is to detect the presence of radio-frequency emissions, and sometimes to analyze their characteristics.  That said, the term is usually associated with scanners which use the “police scanner” radio band.  These were made popular by television and film, but have actually been around for more than a century.

prompt: Can you explain the concept of supply and demand?
chosen: Supply and demand are concepts in economics.  The concept of supply says that if something is available in large quantities at a certain price, then the price of the product will likely drop.  Likewise, the concept of demand says that if something is scarce or in high demand, then the price of the product will likely increase.
rejected: Sure, the supply and demand for a given market determines the prices for goods and services in that market.  The demand for a product or service depends on whether or not people want it, but also on whether or not they can easily obtain it.  The supply of a product or service depends on whether producers are willing or able to supply it at particular prices.  And the two are in constant balance -- the supply and demand for a given product or service determines the price at which it sells.

prompt: How does velcro work?
chosen:
Velcro is a special type of adhesive, which comes in small tufts, or “pebbles”.  The loops on the front of velcro peel back and hook onto the hooks on the back, so that the two separate pieces stick together.  
There’s more to the story than that, though.  You might have noticed that velcro isn’t just used for decorations, it’s used to close clothing, to hang things on walls, to catch equipment, and more.  Velcro is so versatile because velcro is actually sold in two parts -- one with pebbles on it, and one with hooks on it -- and you can mix and match.  If you had two pieces of velcro and one was pebbles, and the other was hooks, you could peel back the pebbles and stick the hooks on the back to them.  Then you could stick those hooks to another surface.  As you peel the pebbles off, the hooks stay on the new surface.  It’s so versatile because you can stick the pebbles on any smooth surface, and the hooks stick to almost anything.  This is one of the reasons that velcro is so useful -- we can make various kinds of materials that velcro sticks

prompt: I've heard of people buying and "flipping" houses in order to make money. What exactly is this?

This is an approach that many investors use to make a regular income by buying and selling homes on a short-term basis. "Flipping" is an action that involves buying a house for less than its value, and selling it for a quick profit. This is most often done within a short period of time, generally within a year. Many people who flip homes do it as a part of a long-term investment plan, or even as a part-time job. This is an attractive approach for some investors, as they can start small with relatively little initial capital.

To make your investment work out, you need to be careful, and, for the most part, you are investing your own time and money as well as the money you are borrowing for this purpose. prompt: How does a heart rate monitor detect the heart beats?
chosen: Well the concept is that there’s a special form of an electrocardiograph that can detect and display heart beats, through an electrode that’s attached to your chest. The electrode sends an electrical signal that represents your heart beats, and this is digitized through an Analog-to-Digital Converter (ADC). The ADC also sends an electrical signal that represents the heart beats, which is displayed on the monitor.
rejected: A pulse oximeter measures the amount of blood the heart pumps in and out.  This indicates the rate at which the heart is beating.  A monitor sends a constant amount of red and infrared light through your finger or earlobe.  When the light is absorbed by the blood flowing through the heart, it’s reflected by your body’s hemoglobin.  The amount of light absorbed and reflected changes depending on the heartbeat.  A monitor uses these light fluctuations to calculate your heart rate.

prompt: Can you explain to me how glass is made?
chosen:
Sure, I can explain it using a simple chemical model:
“Hot silicon dioxide (a combination of silica and oxygen) reacts with sodium carbonate to form the compound sodium silicate.  
Sodium silicate can be heated to 900C to drive off the water and leave the stable sodium oxide and silica.
Glass is made from silica, which means that it is mostly oxygen (silica has oxygen as its dominant atom, with the other atoms just bonding to the oxygen).  Since silica is only just over 10% of the glass, it doesn’t do anything to strengthen the glass.  The rest of the glass is made up of silicon, the most important of which is silicon-oxygen-oxygen, with the silicon atoms bonding to both oxygens, leaving only one oxygen atom in the silica to bond to the silicon.”

During the manufacturing process, there are several steps at which workers can intervene and make adjustments. They can control temperature, add various chemicals, and monitor the glass to make sure that it’s formed correctly.
